Predictably, the girls were more than a little peeved that Casey was getting bigger, mainly because that meant she was now a potential romance rival for Edgar. “That little... bachelorette,” muttered Dolly. “As soon as Edgar sees a booty like that, we might as well start shopping for bridesmaid outfits.” Heloise angrily spat her cigarette to the ground and stomped on it. “There’s no way that’s natural,” said the hellhound. “Her ass was so small yesterday I’d swear she was sitting on her spine and now it’s as big as Janet’s. I’d bet you she took something.” Skyla stress ate a few donuts before speaking her mind. “I think that’s pretty obvious, Heloise. Just look at me. It took me years of binge eating to get this fat and yet her butt is ginormous in no time flat?”

However, Janet was the one of the girls who took this development the worst and her eyes were glowing bright red as she grit her teeth. The red gargoyle giantess didn’t like the idea that she’d run into a girl with an ass even bigger than hers. Her ass was her main weapon over her fellow suitors when it came to courting Edgar and she sure as heck didn’t need any competition. “This is war, Cantus.” Thought Janet to herself. All four of the girls were in rage as they thought about how to deal with this rival of theirs when suddenly they had a flash and put their hands to their chins all at once. They had an idea on how to even up the score.

“Uh,” said Dolly. “I just remembered, I gotta go pick up my parents’ house from the repair shop...” Janet, Heloise and Skyla stared at Dolly as she was backing away. Even though Dolly was a weresheep that made Godzilla look like a lapdog, she was raised by a human couple and they still lived with her, albeit for the most part, hidden away to protect them from predatory monsters. Ironically, weresheeps were one of the 10 biggest human eating species of monsters there were. However, the other three girls could see that Dolly was bluffing but paid her no heed as she ran off.

“Oh, darn,” said Heloise. “I gotta go... uh... rob a bank.” “Rob a bank!?” yelled Skyla in surprise. Heloise gave a nervous smile and the canine giantess was off. Janet rolled her eyes and then she noticed Skyla still around sucking on a jelly donut and then gave a smirk. “My older sister Petra needs me to.. to... uh, hang wallpaper in the basement.” With that, Janet flapped her wings and flew off into the air. Skyla looked around and then cleared her throat. “And I have to go... wait a minute... I’m alone. I don’t need to think of an excuse.” Skyla then ran the other way, still munching on donuts. “Oh,” she groaned. “Sometimes I hate being a turtle.”

At that time back in the woods, Edgar's mother Nadine was going through her potions and held up a vial of potion that was identical to the potion that Sora gave to Casey. However, she looked into the cupboard and scratched her tyrannosaurus-like chin as she snorted out smoke. “That’s funny,” she said. “I would’ve bet money that there was more than one vial of DGS medicine in here.” Suddenly there was a knock on the Nidhogg woman’s door and she snorted. “What the? Who could that be?” Nadine stomped up to the door and right outside was...
125332222222211.title: Fast, Fast, Fast

12533222222221111.content:
Outside the front door was Janet and the 825ft gargoyle giantess was more red in the face than usual. "Janet?" asked Nadine. "What are you doing here?" Janet's eyes glowed bright red as she hissed. "Settling the score with some upstart who thinks she can muscle in on Edgar." Nadine nodded her head. "And who might that be? Fay? Celadon? Elisa?" Janet took a seat in two chairs specifically designed for Nadine's own large behind. "Casey." Nadine raised an eyebrow and snorted as she rubbed her dinosaur-like cheek with her scrawny arms. "I'll admit," said the Nidhogg sorceress. "Edgar has a lot of women who want to be his wife, but I don't remember one called Casey. What species is she?"

Janet then remembered something and gave a smirk. "A gorgon." She said. Nadine's eyes popped out. "What?!" Even though Nadine was hell-bent on her son finding a wife, she was reluctant to allow Edgar to have anything to do with gorgons. Nadine's husband and therefore Edgar's adoptive father was murdered by a gorgon years ago and his petrified corpse was displayed in Nadine's garden. This experience made the dragon giantess reluctant to trust gorgons. Nadine actually bit her lower lip at the possibility that a potential daughter-in-law could be a gorgon. "Don't tell me Edgar is actually considering a relationship with one of those... things. After what Yuri L did to his father?!" Janet stood up and walked up to the dragon woman. “Don’t get too overheated, Nadine. I’m here to stop it before it gets too far. The reason I’m here is because I’m certain that Casey Cantus took something that made her butt grow to be as big as mine.”

Nadine’s eyes popped. “So that’s where that other bottle of potion went. But how would she even know where it is? The only two monsters who knew about it were me and... Sora! That sneaky wyvern. Oh, wait’ll I get my hands on that daughter of mine. Her gray skin will turn bright pink when I’m through with her.” “Sora?” asked Janet. “Oh, that traitor. Remind me to make her life hell when she’s my sister-in-law. Wait! Oh no, we are not going on a tangent. That goop you made is what made that snake hussy’s behind so big. There is no girl in Horrorville who has a bigger can than Janet Hyannis Maza. Nobody!”

Nadine thought for a moment. She did not like the idea of a gorgon being a potential suitor for her son after her experience with the one who killed her husband. Then again, she knew that Edgar had a fondness for round women and that Janet was the closest of the suitors to winning. If the rivalry was limited to the favor to win and a new up and coming suitor, then it would mean either one of them would definitely be the one to marry her son. This was no time for her to be picky. This was a time to be pragmatic. Nadine gave a snort and then she turned to Janet. “It just so happens that I only have one bottle left of that particular potion. Normally it would cost 500 Skulls, but since it’s you, it’s on the house.” Nadine held up the bottle and Janet smiled and tried to grab it, only for Nadine to pull it back.

“However, there is something you must know. It won’t work unless you drink the whole thing.” Janet gave a scoff. “Are you kidding me?” she asked. “My oldest sister could drink three times this much and still be thirsty. At least my fat mostly goes to one place.” Janet took the vial and uncorked it to take a sniff and then gagged. “Ugh! It smells like Petra’s gym shorts. I bet it tastes yucky.” Nadine gave a snort. “I’m a sorceress, not a gourmet cook. Nobody said medicine was supposed to taste good.” Janet put the cork back on the bottle and then smiled. “No worries. I’ll just mix this in with a Polter Zero and it’ll go down like water.” Nadine then kicked Janet in the butt and made her grunt. “No you idiot!” yelled Nadine. “That potion is no good diluted. It will only work if you take it as it is.” Janet let out a groan. “Okay then. I should be the one telling people to eat the disgusting tasting medicine.” The gargoyle woman then let out a laugh. “But it will be worth it when I’m the one walking down the alter with Edgar.” Janet hummed a wedding march before walking out of the room. Nadine let out a sigh. “I hope I’m not making a mistake.”  

After Janet flew off, Heloise ran in and huffed and puffed. “Nadine,” said Dolly. “I came here as fast as I...” “Too late, Heloise,” said Nadine. “Janet just took the last bottle I had.” Heloise’s eye twitched and the hellhound giantess screamed angrily into her own paws. At that moment, Janet was back at her apartment and was looking at the bottle of potion. “Alright, Casey Cantus,” said Janet. “It’s time to remind you who’s the queen behind in Camp Darkly.” Janet sat on her bed and then chugged down the entire bottle. “Ugh!” yelled Janet as she held onto her mouth. “Gross! What did Nadine put in this? Her dirty socks? Where would she even get socks? She doesn’t even wear shoes.”

Suddenly, Janet felt her stomach. “Oh dear.” Janet bent over as her already large butt expanded and caused her bed to collapse. Janet looked back and smirked. “Hello,” she said. “That’s it. I never would’ve used this when I won Miss Horrorville three years ago, but this will definitely get me Edgar in the palm of my hand. Look out, Cantus. Janet’s fighting back. Urk!” Janet then looked back and saw her behind was stuck in the window behind her. She let out a sigh. “A minor setback.” Janet then lifted up her cellphone and called somebody to help her. “Hello,” she said. “Petra. What’s up, Sis? Listen, I’m stuck in a rather unusual jam and well, I’d appreciate it if you came and helped me out. I’ll explain when you get here.”
12533222222221111.title: Janet Gets Competitive

12533222222221112.content:
Nadine opened the door and saw Dolly standing in front of her. The Nidhogg gave a smirk before she said “Hello, Dolly.”. Dolly rolled her eyes. “Yeah,” she said. “Like I’ve never heard that one before. Nadine, aren’t you looking lovely today? New earrings? Oh, I know. You did something with your scales.” Nadine rolled her eyes and smirked. “Don’t tell me, let me guess. There’s a new counselor who has taken a shine to my Edgar and without my permission or knowledge, Sora took one of the two vials I had of a potion that induces butt expansion and gave it to the rather scrawny girl in an attempt to give herself a large butt to attract my son, prompting you to come to me to even up the score.” Dolly gave a look of shock and blinked. “How did you know?” Nadine smirked and showed her hundreds of sharp teeth. “Call it Deja Vu, but when you get as old as me, you get Genre Savvy. Now, tell me, what species of monster is this girl.”

Dolly had to think about it. Should she tell Nadine the truth that Casey Cantus was a gorgon. Nadine’s husband was killed by a gorgon years ago and it was perfectly obvious gorgons weren’t Nadine’s favorite species of monster. Some monsters had certain species of other monsters they couldn’t stand. Dolly being a weresheep didn’t like werewolves that much and barely tolerated having Miranda around. Come to think about it, vampires and werewolves didn’t always get along either. But then Dolly realized something. If Nadine felt the same way about gorgons that Dolly did about werewolves, she’d sure as heck would think twice about allowing the same species of monster that killed her husband get anywhere near her son. Dolly cracked an evil smirk. “Casey Cantus is a gorgon.”

“A gorgon!?” yelled Nadine in horror. “Oh. I know I want Edgar to hurry up and find a wife as soon as he can but a gorgon. Well, at least I can narrow down the search criteria.” Nadine bent over and then took out the vial of potion before she popped off the cork. Dolly took a smell and made a face as if she had been poisoned before Nadine put the cork back on the bottle. “Ugh. I’ve smelt skunk apes that were more pleasing to the nose than that potion.” “It tastes even worse than it smells,” said Nadine. “But you have to drink it down to the very last drop. The last drop is what makes the magic happen.” Dolly let out a groan. “Can I ate least mix it in with some ice cream? That’s how Mom got me to take medicine when I was sick as a lamb.” “No,” said Nadine. “If you dilute the potion, it will be useless. It has to be taken straight.” Dolly took the potion and mumbled. “Well,” she said. “If it means walking down the aisle with Edgar, I’ll do it.” Dolly then took out her wallet and opened it up before she took out a 100 skull bill to Nadine’s surprise. Nadine just shook her head. “This one’s on me.” “Are you sure?” “It would be rude to make a potential daughter-in-law pay for a potion that could help them win my son.”

Dolly nodded her head and then skipped away with the potion. As Dolly was leaving the woods, Janet flew down and landed in front of Nadine’s doorway. “Oh,” said Nadine. “Janet. You just missed Dolly.” Janet gave a look of shock and then felt her butt before she let out a sigh. “Looks like I’ve been dethroned.” Nearby, at a bus stop that had broken under the mass of Casey’s enormous booty, the gorgon giantess was giggling as she looked through a bridal magazine. She hummed a bridal tune, certain that she would have Edgar for her husband.

Meanwhile, Dolly had returned to her house where she lived with her mother Shae and her father Perry. Perry and Shae, unlike their daughter, were humans that raised the weresheep giantess since she was a baby, leaving a monster from a normally dangerous species to humans as docile as well... a lamb. They still lived with their daughter who in turn kept them safe from other monsters who only like humans when they’re in their tummy. Dolly was in her bedroom with her folks on her vanity desk. She had explained her plan to her bite-sized parents and they were shocked at what she was intending to do. “Wait,” said Perry. “You’re telling us that you’re taking that potion to make your butt bigger than Janet’s. “Why not?” asked Dolly. “That hussy Casey Cantus did the same thing. This is war.

“Dolly,” said Shae. “I’m not sure this is such a good idea. What if that potion can’t be undone?” Dolly bit her lip. “I’ll worry about that later. Besides, don’t you want a son-in-law as handsome and sweet as Edgar?” Dolly’s parents climbed their daughter’s woolly body and each perched on one of her horns. “Are you sure that you won’t regret this, pumpkin?” asked Perry. Dolly uncorked the bottle and gave a serious look. “I’m not changing my mind, Daddy,” said Dolly. “This is war.” Perry and Shae smelt the potion and gagged, with Shae even keeling over. “Good grief,” said Perry. “That potion reminds me of when we had to change your diapers. You’re going to drink something that foul?” 
 
Dolly ignored her tiny father and put the bottle to her mouth before drinking it to the last drop, all the while, fighting back tears from the terrible taste. Once the entire potion was swallowed, Dolly belched loudly. Suddenly, she felt her stomach. “Dolly?” asked Shae. “Are you okay, honey?” Dolly got on her knees and her movement caused her folks to slide down her back. “Whoa!” yelled Perry. And that’s when it happened. Dolly’s butt expanded rapidly and caused her skirt to snap off before she she sat down on her bed, accidentally sitting right on top of her parents, though not enough to squash them.

 Dolly shrieked and then the sheep giantess stood up. “Mom?! Dad?!” Both of Dolly’s parents moaned as now Perry was stuck to her left cheek and Shae to her right, both tangled in their daughter’s wool. “Well,” said Shae. “At least we know for sure that potion works.”
12533222222221112.title: Woolly Booty

1253322222222112.content: So who will it be? The gluttonous kappa or the criminally-inclined hellhound?
1253322222222112.title: Skyla or Heloise

choices: Skyla Arrives at Casey's Place to Rub it In
Skyla Stops for a Bite to Eat First
12533222222221121.content:
In the doorway was none other than Skyla and the 735ft tall hawksbill sea turtle kappa was stuffing her greedy fat face with jelly donuts. "Hi, Mrs. Hofferson. Sorry I'm late. I stopped for donuts." Nadine looked at Skyla and blinked. "What brings you here, Skyla?" she asked. "It's not even close to lunchtime." Skyla licked her chubby webbed fingers before she spoke. "By the way, did you know that there's a new suitor in town for Edgar's attention." Nadine blinked. "This is news to me. I really hope that she isn't a gorgon."

"Well," said Shelly. "She had an enormous butt that she didn't have yesterday and it did cross my mind that perhaps one of your potions would be capable of doing such a thing." Nadine gave a snort and rubbed her chin as Sora was in the background going through the fridge and then realized what Skyla was saying and tried to sneak out before Nadine knew what was going on. "Well," said Nadine. "I did make a potion like that that was meant to treat diminished posteriors and it works fast. In fact, I made two bottles. But it sounds like this new girl managed to steal one of the bottles when I wasn't looking. Wait a minute. How would she even know where I kept it? The only one who knew where that potion was besides me was... Sora!"

Sora at the time was attempting to sneak out when she felt her Nidhogg mother glaring at her. "You took my potion without my permission!" yelled the sorceress angrily. "You sneaky wyvern!" "I was only trying to help one of Edgar's suitors! Don't blow a gasket, Mom!" Skyla closed her eyes and then heard a smacking sound and then the sound of Sora screaming in pain. The next thing that Skyla saw when she opened her eyes was a large pink imprint of Nadine's clawed three-fingered hand on one of Sora's butt cheeks and the wyvern giantess rubbing her bottom in pure pain. "That'll teach you to go behind my back." Said Nadine sternly. Nadine then bent over and picked up the vial of magic potion. "Now," she said. "I'm going to have to find a different hiding spot for this vial."

But then Skyla ran in front of Nadine. "Wait, Nadine! Don't be rash! Think about it. Edgar loves larger women. If two of his suitors had really big enormous butts, then it would narrow down the search and then it would be only two girls in the lead for Edgar's hand." Nadine was going to put away the vial but then she realized that Skyla indeed had a point. "Hmm," she said. "That's actually a good idea. Hmmm." Sora then gave a smirk. "That doesn't mean you're off the hook," growled Nadine, prompting Sora to frown. "Of course, I still don't know." Skyla bit into a cruller before speaking. "Need I remind you who it was that babysat Edgar when he was a kid." "Fair enough, Skyla. In that case, I won't charge you a cent."

Nadine waddled towards the cupboard and took out the bottle. "Now, Skyla," she said. "This is very important. The potion will only work if you drink it to the last drop and it must be undiluted. I must warn you, it tastes terrible." Skyla then gave a scoff. "Oh please," she said. "I happen to have a refined sense of taste." Skyla then took the bottle and uncorked it. She took a sniff and gagged. "Good thing I'm already green." Skyla then licked the neck of the bottle and then her eyes popped. "Yum!" she yelled. In seconds, Skyla chugged the entire bottle as Sora and Nadine looked in surprise and disgust. "I think I'm going to be sick." Groaned Nadine.

Skyla finished the potion and was licking the inside of the bottle. "That was delicious. Got any more?" "No," said Nadine. "And I don't think you need to have any more at the moment. I can't believe you drank that all and liked it. It's gross." "Mom," said Sora. "This is Skyla P. Laird. If there were two of her, it'd cause a famine. Wait, shouldn't her butt be growing now." Sora grunted and got on her knees. In seconds, her yellow-green-skinned and brown-reddish spotted ass had expanded and demolished the wall of Nadine's hovel. "Oh my." Said Sora. Nadine's jaw dropped. "My house!" she yelled. Skyla looked back and then spanked herself. "Oh," she said. "Look at me. I'm absolutely pear-shaped. Oh, wait until Casey sees me. In fact, I think I'll go to her house and show her."

Skyla left the hovel as Nadine let out a groan. "I don't care who marries Edgar of the two of them as long as the bride pays for both the wedding and my hovel!" After Skyla left, Dolly arrived and blinked. "What happened here?" asked Dolly. "It looks like a wrecking ball struck the place. Now, do you have anything that can make my woolly golden butt as big as a meteor?" "Sorry, Dolly," said Nadine. "Just gave the last to Skyla." "Dog Waffles!" yelled Dolly as she stomped her hoof. At that time, Skyla was still waddling down the street and ate the last of her donuts as she dragged her butt across the ground. She realized how much bigger her butt was than her shell. "Hmm," she said. "Maybe I didn't think this through."
12533222222221121.title: Booty on the Half Shell

12533222222221122.content:
At the door was none other than Heloise and she was smiling at Nadine. "Hello, Mrs. Hofferson," she said. "How are you today?" "Heloise?" asked Nadine. "What are you doing here? I'm doing fine. Except I seem to have misplaced a bottle of magic potion." Heloise rubbed her chin and realized that Casey must've had something to do with this potion. "That's... uh... interesting, Nadine. What exactly was this potion supposed to do?" Nadine looked at Heloise curiously. "Why do you care?" Heloise gave a scoff. "Well," she said. "It's entirely possible that you'll wind up my mother-in-law if things work out with Edgar and I figured that I should brush up on my spell casting." Nadine nodded her head, falling completely for the hellhound's deception.

"That makes sense I guess. The potion in question is quite harmless with no threats to the health. Of course, it does have a strange effect. It makes the drinker's buttocks grow to an enormous size." "Oh, really?" asked Heloise. "It's relatively easy to make. Just a combination of dragon berries and royal jelly fermented for a week and mixed in with blue daisies and tyrannosaurus teeth," said Nadine. "It works fast." "And why would you make a potion like that, Mrs. Hofferson?" asked Heloise. Nadine let out a sigh. "It's meant for use on people who have a very rare medical condition where their buttocks are so worn away they're effectively sitting on their spine. My cousin had it and it was quite embarrassing for a dragon. I had two vials of the stuff but the other one disappeared."

Heloise of course, had no idea that Sora took the bottle without telling Nadine and took it to Casey, so she assumed the worst. "That little snake-haired creep," thought the 800ft demonic dog. "She broke in and stole that potion from Nadine. Hmmm. I gotta admit, she did a good job. It almost looks as if somebody from the inside took the potion. If I had those thieving skills, I never would've gotten caught. Thank goodness I had the choice between going to Under Gloom and working at a lame camp for brats." Heloise was actually a reformed criminal who was sentenced to do community service at Camp Darkly and as such she did her job rather half-assed and didn't seem to care what she did in front of impressionable children. That didn't change the fact that she was one of Edgar's suitors and Nadine didn't seem to be too concerned with that fact.

However, right now, Nadine was rubbing her chin. "I'm still not sure how they did it. I didn't hear anything last night." Before Nadine could even think of what happened, there was a knock at her door. "Now who could that be?" asked the Nidhogg giantess. The dinosaur-like dragon stomped to the door and outside was a strange alien-creature resembling a blue-gray-skinned Xenomorph with six arms, an eyeless face, a skeletal tail, sharp teeth and a relatively flat chest. This creature was Xeno, the only giantess in Horrorville to be an extraterrestrial. Xeno was part of an invasion force that tried to attack Earth, only to change their mind when they landed in the part of the world populated by giant monsters and realized they were outmatched. Xeno was left behind because she forgot to refuel her spaceship before they left. Fortunately she was relatively harmless and normally didn't want anything to do with anyone.

Xeno shrieked in alien language as Nadine lowered her head to the alien's level. "Hi, Xeno. What can I do you for today?" Xeno let out a few shrieks and Nadine seemed to understand her. "I see. Are you sure that's a good idea." Xeno held her head in pain and hissed. "Okay, okay, alright, I'll see if I have something for you." As Nadine was tending to Xeno, she left the bottle of butt-expanding potion completely unguarded and Heloise gave a smirk. She snuck her way right to the bottle and snatched it away, shoving it in the back of her skirt in order to smuggle it out without Nadine knowing and snuck right out the door. As Heloise was leaving, Skyla came into Nadine's hovel and was panting and holding her stomach. "Skyla?" asked Nadine as she was rooting around her cupboard for potions. "This must be my day for seeing people. Skyla stopped and looked around. "Did I just see Heloise in here." Nadine gave a snort. "She was in here a second ago." Skyla let out a groan. "I knew I shouldn't have stopped for donuts on the way here."

- - - - -

Soon, Heloise was back at her apartment and took out the bottle of potion as she was watching a Dr. Madman cartoon on the television. In the cartoon, the despicable Dr. Madman was inside a house of some sort and had gotten himself a bowl of popcorn as he was sitting in front of the television himself. "Oh yes," said Dr. Madman in the cartoon. "ZX is on the tube tonight and there's no way I'm missing it." However, outside, looking in at Dr. Madman was Madman's worst enemy, the bounty hunter Mangaga and he gave a smirk as he looked in. "That taco-muncher is in for it now," said the metallic mutant. "I've laid a clever snare right on the roof by the satellite. Once I cut the power, Dr. Madman will climb the roof to fix the TV and step in the rope that I attached to an airplane about to take off."

Mangaga let out a snicker and walked up to the fusebox outside before turning his hand into a pair of metal scissors and cutting the power, causing the television to break out in static. "Aw nuts," said Dr. Madman. "And ZX starts in 10 minutes. Oh well, I'll just find some other house to watch it. It's Mangaga's TV anyway." Mangaga gave a look of shock and looked outside to see his own mailbox, remembering that it was his own TV he sabotaged. Mangaga let out a scream and climbed the roof to fix the satellite, falling into his own snare trap in the process. By the time Mangaga realized his mistake, he looked to see the rope moving and his eye twitched. "I really hate that guy." He mumbled before he was dragged away screaming by the airplane. Dr. Madman just gave a smug grin. "That Mangaga is just plane stupid."

As Dr. Madman laughed in the cartoon, Heloise changed the channel to a horror movie starring Corona Poe. As a spear-wielding maniac was moving through the shadows in the movie, Heloise held up the bottle and sniffed it before she covered her nose. "This stuff smells horrible and I'm a hellhound so I'm not really one to talk. Heloise stuck her tongue into the bottle and gagged. "Yucky! Ugh! Nadine could at least make a potion that tasted good." Heloise got up and looked into her mirror to see that her butt hadn't gotten any bigger. "No good. Guess you have to drink the whole thing for it to work. Scrud. Only for Edgar, only for Edgar."

Heloise held up the bottle and chugged it as her large and black-furred and pointy-tailed rear was throbbing....
12533222222221122.title: The Round Hound

125332222222211221.content:
At that time, Casey had arrived by the side of the forest and saw Sora flying down from the sky. "Sorry I'm late, Casey," said Sora. "I had to take some pictures for a fashion show. You have no idea what a diva Fanny Stein can be." Sora then eyed Casey's rear end and saw that it was now as tall as the gorgon giantess was. "My," said Sora. "That's some serious junk in the trunk. When mom makes a potion, she makes a potion." Casey gave a smile as her snake hair hissed happily. “Oh,” she said. “Wait’ll your brother sees me now, Sora. You are so going to be the best lady at the wedding.” Sora gave a scoff. “Naturally. Of course, you have to meet Mom first. I gotta warn you, gorgons aren’t her favorite species of monster.”  

Casey gave a gulp. “Really?” she asked. Sora nodded her head. “Years ago,” said Sora. “Dad was petrified to death by a gorgon serial killer from Fearfield. In fact, after her died, Mom put him out in the garden. If you see a wyvern statue by the house, I’d appreciate it if you didn’t so much as touch it.” Casey nodded her head. “I’m sorry,” she said. “That’s so sad. And creepy.” Sora nodded her head again. “It is very important that you are very careful around Mom. Don’t give her a reason to dislike you. Though at this point she probably wouldn’t care if the little twerp married Morgan Le Fay. Come on.” Sora flew ahead as Casey waddled on foot. “It must be great to fly.” Muttered the gorgon giantess with the bindi and the cobra hair. “Whoa!” As Casey moved through the woods, her enormous booty brushed against and knocked over several trees. “Oops!” Sora couldn’t help but snicker.

Casey and Sora soon reached Nadine’s hovel where the Nidhogg giantess was rooting around her cupboard trying to find the potion that went missing. “Where! Where! Where! Oh, you gotta be kidding me! I knew I had that potion somewhere.” “Uh-oh,” said Sora. “Uh, everything okay, Mom?” Nadine got up and gave a snort. “You know the potion I had in here for treating DGS? Somehow, it’s gone missing. How does that even happen?!” As Nadine was searching, Sora had to duck as Nadine tossed an empty flask over her head. Casey grunted because the flask got stuck between her massive cheeks. As Casey stepped forward, she grunted because her large rear got stuck in the doorway.

“Hmmph?” asked Nadine as she turned her head. Nadine then gasped and dropped her jaw, revealing her hundreds of sharp teeth as she spotted Casey. “Who is this?” asked the dinosaur-like dragoness. “Oh,” said Sora. “Mom. Meet Casey Cantus. She’s the newest player in the game.” “A gorgon with interest in my son?!” asked Nadine. “Hmm. Well, I guess not all gorgons are like Yuri. I already knew that. But seriously.” Casey blushed and gave a nervous look as Nadine stomped up towards her to inspect her and even sniffed her. “She looks friendly enough. But my baby boy likes women with curves. She needs far more... meat... on...” Nadine noticed Casey’s rather large behind and was shocked. “Why is your rear so big and yet your upper body is rail thin.” Casey bit her lip and her snakes were hissing. “Well, you see that...” Sora then cleared her throat. “I kinda sorta helped her keep up with Janet, Dolly, Nat and the rest of the girls.” Nadine realized something. “Sora, you sneak! You took my two bottles of potion!”

"Huh?!" yelled Sora. "That's odd. I'll admit I did take one of those vials of potion but only one. I left the other one where it was. Mom, did anyone else happen to come by." Nadine felt her chin and tried to remember who came by. "Well," she said. "First Heloise popped in and said she wanted to learn about how to use magic but she must've left when Xeno came in and..." Nadine suddenly realized exactly what happened and her eyes popped. "I am so stupid!" she yelled. "Heloise was arrested for petty theft in the past. She must've stolen that vial when I wasn't looking. How could I be so daft?"

"Wait!?" yelled Casey with a gasp. "You mean to tell me that Heloise took that potion too!?" Sora gave a scoff. "What did you expect, Casey?" asked Sora. "These girls are competitive. It's a good thing that Mom only had two bottles of potion or things would've gotten really hairy.” Nadine was at first upset, but then she rubbed her chin because she had a thought. “Come to think about it,” she said. “This might work towards our advantage. After all, with two girls bigger than all the others, it would make it a whole lot easier for Edgar to narrow down his search for a bride.” Nadine let out a laugh as Sora looked at her mother in concern.

Suddenly there were footsteps and Casey turned around, shattering Nadine’s window with her enormous rear and looked in surprise as who should she see but...
125332222222211221.title: To Nadine's House We Go

12533222222222.content:
Manacle of the Hippo Queen

This one is a crossover with my Campfire Neo Neapolitan using an OC of the 12th Doctor.

Carina Veldarez is a gorgon with scales dyed in rainbow colors and different types of colorful snakes for hair. She has an exaggerated hourglass figure with Z-cup breasts and an enormous butt. This loud and crazy punk singer gorgon is minding her own business in her favorite restaurant, Neo Neapolitan when a family heirloom belonging to one of the proprietresses accidentally winds up on her wrist, causing her already large butt to become even more enormous.
12533222222222.title: Manacle of the Hippo Queen

125332222222221.content:
It was a bright and sunny spring break Monday in Direopolis, a city populated mainly by mythological monsters that were as big as skyscrapers. There was a lunch rush that day at Neo Neapolitan, the local restaurant. Direopolis was a rather unusual restaurant. The three proprietresses couldn’t decide what type of restaurant to make it so they compromised; Neo Neapolitan was 1/5 pizzeria, 1/5 hamburger joint, 1/5 ice cream parlor, 1/5 donut shop and 1/5 pancake house. The restaurant was run by 3 monster giantesses who married a trio of human brothers. The sextet was in the kitchen right now.
 First walked in the waitress, Salli Van Richter and her husband Allen, the middle brother of the husbands. Salli was a rather unusual monster. She was a vanilla-skinned and black-haired loxodon, a monster resembling an Asian elephant. Salli wasn’t an ordinary loxodon either because her father was a vampire and as well as having all the powers of a vampire, Salli had fangs in both her mouth and in her trunk. She was the nicest of the proprietresses which was why she was the waitress. Salli mainly acted as the bodyguard to her timid husband.

Second of the proprietresses was Pam Hocker and her husband Norman. Pam was a chocolate brown-skinned wereboar resembling a wild sow with six tusks and long blonde hair. Unusually for a wereboar she was born with wings on her back. Pam was mainly the delivery girl because she was very immature, childish and didn’t have a lot of common sense, which made her a liability as far as her sisters-in-law were concerned. She and her husband, Norman, the youngest of the Wraith Brothers, were prefect for each other because they were both prone to rash decision making.
 Lastly there was Patty Round and her husband Wes who were working the grill. Patty was a 1350ft pink-skinned Egyptian werehippopotamus with golden red hair, a cyan tattoo of a pyramid over her right eye and a massive butt that was wider than she was tall like was the case with most werehippos. Patty and Wes were the ones in charge due to being the smartest and most responsible of the couples that ran Neo Neapolitan and they were a clear case of opposites attract. Patty was the most stern and serious of the three wives and like a real hippopotamus, was very temperamental, especially towards Pam’s incompetence. In contrast, Wes was just as serious but more calm and snarky, making him more passive aggressive compared to his wife.
 Patty turned her head and saw Salli picking her left ear with her trunk. “Carina just placed her order...” “I already know it, Salli,” said Patty. “A double brontosaurus burger with seismosaurus bacon, hold the onions with a side of chilli fries and a dragonberry sundae with walnuts, whipped cream and gummy worms.” They were referring to Carina Veldarez, a local punk rock singer. Carina was a gorgon with scales dyed in rainbow colors and different types of colorful snakes for hair. She also had an exaggerated hourglass figure with Z-cup breasts and an enormous butt. However, Carina had no indoor voice at all and was prone to yelling everything she said. In a way, they didn’t need a waitress to take Carina’s orders. Allen gave a scoff. “Patty,” he said. “Don’t you think you’re picking on Salli lately? She has the biggest ears of us. If my wife keeps waiting on bigmouths like Carina, she is going to go deaf.” Patty let out a sigh. “Don’t worry, Allen. I already put an add in the paper. We’ll hire an extra waitress. But Salli will be the boss.” Salli gave a smile. “Oh. Also, Mia wants a pepperoni pan pizza with anchovies, hold the jalapeños.” “Got it, Salli.” Said Patty.

As Patty opened the fridge and took out a large slice of pepperoni, she made a startling discovery. Right behind the pepperoni was a pair of gold Egyptian style bracelets that looked like snakes with the heads of hippopotami and bright blue sapphires for eyes. “Oh no,” groaned Patty. “Mom forgot her bracelets the last time she visited.” Wes let out a sigh. “That means they’ll be back.” Wes didn’t care much for when Patty’s parents visited. Sure, Wes got along with Patty’s werehippo mother perfectly fine, but Patty’s human father hated him and believed Patty could’ve done better. Patty held up the bracelets and then turned to her two sisters-in-law. “Salli,” she says. “Pam. Bad news. My mother left her manacles behind in the fridge.” Salli just stared at Patty. “What were they doing in the fridge?” “That’s not the point, Salli,” said Patty. “Listen and listen carefully. These bracelets were made to be worn by a werehippo. Absolutely NOBODY except for a werehippo is to wear them.”

Pam however, looked at the bracelets and gave a snort. “But they look so pretty,” she says. “Norman, how do you think I’d look with those bracelets on?” Norman actually had to stop and think about Pam dressed as an Egyptian queen with Neith Round’s bracelets around her wrists. “Baby,” he said. “I just wish they had a pig goddess in Egyptian mythology.” “Pamela Petunia Hocker,” grunted Patty sternly. “Do you have cream cheese in your ears? No one is to wear these bracelets! If anyone other than my mom wore them, it would be a disaster.” Patty laid the bracelets on the counter before she returned to her grill. Norman turned to Allen and rolled his eyes. “I don’t see what the big deal is. Neith wears more jewelry than a hip hopper. Like it would be a crime if someone else wore those stupid manacles.”

Patty ignored her in-laws as she prepared the french fries and the sundae for Carina’s order and was now waiting on the burger patties. As Patty’s back was turned, Pam picked up one of the bracelets to examine it. It was at that moment they heard Carina shout “WHAT’S GOING ON IN THERE?! I’M ****ING STARVING! COME ON AND GET MY FOOD ON!” The sound of Carina’s voice caused Patty to toss the bracelet into the air as Patty was about to answer Carine. “Keep your snakes on, Carina. It’s ready.” Salli let out a sigh as she picked up the sundae and the fries as Patty put Carina’s burger on the tray. Salli had plugged her ears as she walked out.

But what neither Pam nor Salli nor Patty knew was that one of Neith’s bracelets had landed in Carina’s...
125332222222221.title: Bracelet Yourself

choices: Somebody Has to Take Carina Home
They Decide to Keep Carina at the Restaurant
1253322222222211.content:
The bracelet had landed in the fries and was completely unnoticed as Salli walked out carrying Carina's order. Outside, Carina was tapping her fingers on the table and her snake hair was drooling. “I’M WAITING HERE!” Patty walked out carrying the burger, fries and sundae that Carina ordered and was wearing a pair of earmuffs. “Don’t worry,” said Salli. “I’ve got your order right here.” Salli laid Carina’s order on the table and Carina wasted no time biting into the burger as her snake hair sucked up the sundae. Carina then made a face of pain and grabbed ahold of her head. Allen gave a laugh. “That’s what happens when a cold-blooded monster overindulges on the sundaes.” Salli and Allen shared a laugh before Carina recovered and then reached for her chili fries. But before she could bite into any of them, Neith’s bracelet begun to shake. “HUH!?” asked Carina.

The bracelet then flew onto Carina’s wrist and made her yell as it tightened. “WHAT THE?!” Salli turned around and saw the bracelet before she gasped. “Patty!” she yelled. “Patty!” Patty and Pam came out of the kitchen with Wes and Norman on their shoulders. “Salli,” said Norman. “What are you doing? We already have one big mouth around here. What’s with all the shouting?” Wes then noticed Carina trying to remove Neith’s bracelet off of her wrist. “Hey, Patty,” he said. “Isn’t that your mom’s bracelet?” Patty’s jaw dropped. “Oh no.” She said. “SOMEBODY GET THIS FREAKING BRACELET OFF OF ME!” yelled Carina. Carina kept on struggling and then suddenly, her butt begun to expand and press against her back. Carina moaned as her rear end grew to be twice as tall as she was and several times wider than it was before.

Allen, Norman and Wes looked in surprise as their wives laid them on the table. Even Salli and Pam were shocked but Patty slapped herself in the face. Everyone in the restaurant was staring and even took photographs. “Wow!” yelled Norman. “Her butt is super huge now.” “It’s even bigger than Patty’s.” Said Allen. Wes glared at his brother. “Well it is.” Patty let out a sigh. “Any creature that isn’t a werehippo who wears that bracelet will develop the rear end of a werehippo. It was the bracelet of my ancestor, the werehippo queen Tontepsut, who was much bigger than any other werehippo that ever lived.” Carina begun to sputter. “ARE YOU KIDDING?! I’M SUPPOSED TO BE THE QUEEN OF ROCK, NOT THE QUEEN OF HIPPOS!” Carina tried to yank the bracelet off, but it tightened again.

At that moment, the door opened up and another monster came in. Only this monster wasn’t one of the regular customers. Instead, she was a raspberry blue-skinned, pear-shaped manticore as tall and fat as Patty, Pam and Salli with long brown hair. She was wearing a red fedora with flowers in it along with a green floral print muumuu. Her name was Dorothy Coward and she was a business partner of the Rounds, Hockers and Van Richters who was originally hired to fill in for Patty while she was indisposed. Dorothy walked into the room and looked in surprise at Carina’s enormous rear and Neith’s bracelet. She even blinked slightly. “What did I miss?” she asked. Wes rolled his eyes. “Could somebody give the blue lioness a copy of the script?” Salli flew up to Dorothy and whispered what happened into her ear as Dorothy’s eyes popped. “You have GOT to be kidding me.” She said.

Dorothy let out a sigh. “You six really attract a lot of weirdness. Patty’s from an Egyptian family, Salli’s a vampire and Pam’s as dumb as dumb can be. That’s a regular recipe for disaster.” “Dorothy,” said Norman. “Shut up. We get enough sass from Wes.” “You know, Dorothy,” said Salli. “Maybe if you were married...” Dorothy gave an uncontrolled laugh. “You’re out of your mind if you think I’d marry a human of all things.” Allen, Wes and Norman all glared at Dorothy before Carina butted in. “HELLO!” yelled Carina. “THERE’S STILL THE MATTER OF THIS THING STUCK TO MY WRIST!” Carina tried to pull the bracelet off but it was on too tight. “DARN IT! THIS SUCKER IS STUCK!” Pam grabbed hold of the bracelet and tried to yank it off but even her strength couldn’t remove it. Salli and Patty grabbed hold of the bracelet but even the three working together couldn’t pull the bracelet off and fell back, accidentally destroying an empty table in the process.

Carina groaned as Dorothy walked forward and smirked. “I know how to get that bracelet off.” Carina gave a sigh of relief that quickly turned into a scream of horror as Dorothy took out a meat cleaver from her purse and then brought it down. Carina pulled her hand out of the way as Dorothy’s cleaver hit the table right next to Wes, Allen and Norman. Allen screamed in fear and foamed at the mouth as Norman fainted and Wes clutched his chest. “Dorothy, you psycho!” yelled Patty. “You can’t just chop Carina’s hand off!” Dorothy just let out a sigh. “I was just trying to help.” Everyone around stared at Dorothy in fear and backed away. Carina let out a moan. “PATTY!” she shouted, forcing Patty to plug her ears. “DOESN’T YOUR MOM KNOW A WAY TO REMOVE THIS BRACELET!?”

Patty gave a snort. “Yeah,” she said. “I’m sure Mom will be able to get this stupid thing off. But she and Dad are on vacation and won’t be back until tonight.” Carina gave a groan and then grabbed herself by the face and shook her head as she grunted and then her butt started to bulge again. At this moment, Pam realized something. “Wait a minute. What about the other bracelet?” Salli and Patty’s eyes bulged out and realized that for once, Pam had a valid point. Patty ran into the kitchen just in time to see the bracelet shaking in the air. It would’ve flown off onto somebody else’s wrist, but Patty grabbed it, tossed it in a strongbox and then locked it up tight. “Oh no you don’t!” she yelled. “The last thing that we need is for that thing to attach onto somebody else.”

Outside, Carina was trying to pull her pants up as they were slipping from her growing behind. “PATTY! PAM! SALLI!” Dorothy shook her head. “We’re going to have to do something about Carina and that bracelet until Neith comes back from vacation.” “Don’t forget that second bracelet locked in the strongbox.” Said Salli. “Well, what do you propose we do?” asked Pam. “Well,” said Patty. “We have two options. Either we keep Carina and the bracelets here until Mom comes back from vacation or one of us will have to take them both to our place.”

What’s the option?
1253322222222211.title: Surprise in the Fries

12533222222222111.content:
“I don’t think that leaving Carina or that infernal second bracelet at Neo Neapolitan is such a good idea.” Said Wes. “But I just bought a new rug for our living room.” Said Salli. “It’s your wife’s bracelet, Wes,” said Allen. “Carina should stay with you two.” “Why can’t she stay with Dorothy?” asked Norman. Dorothy gave a growl. “I wasn’t even here when this mess happened. You’re out of your mind. She should stay with you and Pam.” “NO WAY!” yelled Carina as her butt knocked down three more tables. “PAM’S HOUSE IS A PIG STY!” Pam gave a snort. “I’m a pig. What do you expect?” Patty let out a groan. “Arguing will get us nowhere. I know how to settle this. We’ll play Rock Paper Scissors to see who has to watch the gorgon and the bracelets.”

“Last time we played Rock Paper Scissors,” said Pam. “We tied up for hours! That game is broken. We should draw straws.” “We can’t,” said Wes. “We need all the straws for the drinks.” “Oh,” said Dorothy. “I have an idea.” Everyone looked as Dorothy took out four matches and handed a match to Pam, Patty and Salli while holding the last one herself. “This will decide which one of us keeps Carina out of trouble and hold onto Neith’s bracelets. Whoever gets burned first...” “That sounds like a bad idea, Dorothy,” said Allen. “Someone could get hurt.” Salli shook her head up and down as Pam gave an uneasy look.” Carina just rolled her eyes and then lit all four of the matches at once as they begun to burn down. Wes let out a sigh. “Just one normal day,” Wes said to himself. “Is that too much to ask.”

After one minute, the flames burn down and the one who ends up stuck with Carina and the bracelets is...
12533222222222111.title: Who's Minding the Gorgon?

choices: Neith Came In Through the Front Door
Someone Else Came in From the Back Door
12533222222222112.content:
Everyone decided that it would be best to keep Carina in one place and wait for Patty's parents, Neith and Carter to return from their vacation in Paris. Carina didn't like waiting, but she figured that she had no other choice. "AS LONG AS I'M WAITING," said the gorgon. "I MIGHT AS WELL ORDER SOME DINNER!" Salli let out a sigh. "If only Tanya wasn't visiting her sick mother," said the elephant giantess. "Carina could damage somebody else's ears." "AND I'M SICK OF BURGERS AND SUNDAES! I'LL TAKE A PANINI FOR A CHANGE!" Dorothy gave a smug grin Patty's way. "It's a good thing that I decided to do you a favor and add panini to the menu." Patty gave a snort. "Don't be smug." "Hmm," said Dorothy. "Come to think about it, we might consider the idea of expanding into other food markets. Perhaps Lapis might be interested in fishing for us full time."

Salli had brought Carina her panini and Carina's snake hair was slowly picking away at the cheese as the gorgon lounged back, her rear knocking over three tables just by sitting down. Pam gave a snort before she Patty handed her a few boxes of pizza. "Pam," said Patty. "Even with this craziness going on, we still are running a restaurant here. Please be a dear and take these calzones to Memphis." "Why don't you do it? She's your next door neighbor." "Because I have to stay here and do the cooking, remember?" Norman gave a scoff. "Come on, Patty. Why don't you deliver the pizzas and Pam handle the kitchen?" "Because Pam only knows how to make donuts, Norman," said Patty. "Frankly, I'm not sure how you even survive." Pam snorted and then walked off as Carina laid back and watched television.

On the TV, Esther Tortuga was doing a news report. "Today, chaos broke out in the supermarket where a trio of masked madmen wearing boxer shorts and thick glasses broke in and stole everything in the Mexican food aisle. Authorities believe this is in response to the discontinuation of the Mal Verde hot sauce. On the way out, the criminals dismantled the smoothie machine at the kiosk and planted dynamite just to make sure. Whoever these villains are, it is clear that they love tacos and hate smoothies. Here we have a witness. Ms. Christina Sweet. Ms. Sweet, can you tell us anything about these dangerous criminals." The witness was Christina Sweet, an orange-skinned werecrocodile and chauffeur to Vienna, the gargoyle jazz singer. "Anybody who likes nachos and tacos can't be all bad. I like to combine them." Christina shook her head. "Personally," she said. "I like my nachos on a pizza."

After the news report was over, Carina decided to pass the time by playing cards with Patty, Pam, Dorothy and Salli. Norman had climbed up Pam's ear and looked to see Patty's hand, until Wes glared at him. Dorothy tried to use her tail to steal one of Carina's cards but Carina's snakes bit her in the tail and made her grunt in pain. "THERE SURE ARE A LOT OF CHEATERS IN THIS HOUSE!" yelled Carina. Wes nodded his head.

After the card game, Carina was passing her time by painting an image on her large behind. "Where did she get the paint?" asked Patty. "It's not paint," said Salli. "It's the mayonnaise, ketchup and mustard we had stockpiled from the kitchen." Patty let out a sigh. "I hope that Mom gets here fast. Carina's going stir crazy.

It was at this moment that...
12533222222222112.title: Waiting for Neith

125332222222221122.content:
While everyone else was waiting for Neith to arrive in the front of the restaurant, somebody else walked up to the back of the restaurant. This giantess was a 1300ft high minotaur with brown, white and black stripes all over her body that made her resemble a cross between a cow and an okapi. Body shape-wise she was very fat, especially in the stomach and had large buck teeth. She had long gray hair and wore what looked like a bikini that was made of iron with a hole made to fit her udder. The cow woman looked inside and scratched her chin. “That’s odd,” she said. “I would’ve thought that at least Wes and Patty were in the kitchen.”

The minotaur’s name was Viola Poe and she was Wes, Allen and Norman’s stepmother. Viola for the most part didn’t have any problems with her 3 daughters-in-law, but she had a tendency to come in unannounced and to the brothers’ dismay, she had a habit of putting her snout where it didn’t belong. At that moment, she had left the brothers’ father at the Rainbow Tongue Hotel in Direopolis and went on ahead to visit the boys at work, blissfully unaware of the curse of the bracelets that afflicted Carina. Not one to give up and come back later, the okapi-like minotaur simply walked in through the back door into the kitchen and looked around. “That’s odd,” she said. “Normally they’re not open this late. Huh?”

Viola noticed the strongbox used to contain the second of Neith’s bracelets and bent over to read a note that Patty left on it. “Do Not Open This Box.” Viola just gave a scoff. “Well,” she said. “Now I gotta.” Viola opened up the strongbox and saw Neith’s second bracelet inside. “Ugh,” said Viola. “Must be another one of Neith’s tacky pieces of Egyptian jewelry. Hmm.” Viola picked up the bracelet and then put it on her wrist with a laugh as she looked at it in awe. “I must say,” she said. “This looks less tacky than the rest of her jewel. Guess my daughter-in-law’s mom isn’t as unfashionable as I thought she was.”

Suddenly, Viola grunted and held her stomach. “What the?” asked the okapi-like minotaur. Viola grunted as her metallic bikini bottom was being stretched out, revealing her brown, white and black striped booty that was getting bigger and bigger. The middle-aged minotaur looked at her growing rear and gave a look of shock before she grunted. “Okay,” she muttered. “What kind of trouble did those stepsons of mine get into now?”

Into the kitchen walked Salli carrying Wes, Allen and Norman. “Are you sure that Neith’s bracelet is locked up tight, bro?” asked Norman. “Patty had the sense to put it in a strongbox,” said Wes. “She’s not stupid like Pam, you know.” Allen then spotted Viola. “Mom?” he asked. Wes and Norman turned their attention and gasped at Viola under the spell of the bracelet. “Good grief!” yelled Wes. Viola turned her attention to her sons and Salli and grunted as her metal bikini bottom was cracking. “Wesley,” she said. “Allen, Norman. What exactly is going on?” Allen and Norman pushed Wes onto the kitchen table as Wes grunted. The oldest of the brothers glared at his younger siblings before he felt his minotaur mother staring down at him.

Wes looked nervously and then noticed the strongbox opened. “Mom,” he said. “Tell me you didn’t open that strongbox. Patty clearly left a note not to do that.” Viola gave an angry snort and crossed her arms as her butt pushed against all of Patty’s frying pans. “Wesley Wraith Round,” says the minotaur giantess sternly. “Do not change the subject. My butt is even bigger than Patty’s. At this rate your father won’t remember what my face looks like. You have 60 seconds to explain what made me so big.” “It’s the bracelet you put on, Mom!” yelled Wes as the enormous cow glared down at him. “It’s cursed. Anyone who wears it and isn’t a werehippo like Patty or her mom will get the butt of the werehippo queen.”

Upon learning what happened, Viola smacked herself in the face. “Dammit.” She grumbled. “Salli?” asked Patty. “What’s going on in the kitchen?” “Viola’s here, Patty. She put on the other bracelet.” “What?! Are you kidding me!? Didn’t she read the warning on the strongbox!?” “You know our mother-in-law, Patty. She likes to stick her snout where she shouldn’t.” “You’re one to talk about snouts,” said Viola as she grabbed the end of Salli’s trunk and then turned around. “Just look at me.” Viola tapped on her left cheek and made it shake. She then gave a grunt of pain. “Mom,” said Allen. “Maybe you should give up on the idea of iron bikinis. It will never catch on.” Viola gave a scoff. “Bit your tongue, Allen. I’m not giving up on it.” “Yeah, Al,” whispered Norman. “You know how stubborn Mom can be when it comes to her fashion ideas. Need I bring up the potted palm tree earrings?”

Viola gave a snort before she grunted and begun to wobble. “Whoa, whoa!” The minotaur was quickly losing her balance and her three stepsons looked up at her in fear. “Oh no.” Groaned Wes. Before the brothers could react, Viola fell back butt first on top of them and the table and caused it to shatter beneath her enormous weight and the mass of her larger than usual butt. In the main dining room, Carina struggled to stand up before speaking. “WHAT HAPPENED?!” yelled the gorgon in the same boat as Viola. Patty let out a sigh. “Life in Direopolis.” Viola grunted and stood up, her three human stepsons plastered but still alive to her more massive than usual butt cheeks. “Good grief,” muttered Wes. “It’s been years since this happened.” Norman and Allen both grunted in agreement as their dizzy mother was walking right out the back door to the kitchen, her sons still stuck to her massive fanny. The massive minotaur tore the wall off of the kitchen door.

In the other room, Patty shook her head and then her cellphone rang. “Hello?” asked Patty. “Oh, hi Mom. Things just went from bad to worse. Now there are two girls wearing your bracelets and one of them is Viola Poe. Don’t give me that attitude. We need to avert... what. Oh no.” Carina gave a hiss. “WHAT DID SHE SAY?” asked the gorgon giantess. Patty let out a sigh. “Mom ate some bad escargot in Paris and can’t make it back tonight.” Carina let out an angry scream and shattered every window in the entire restaurant. Patty let out a sigh. “I REALLY hate Mondays.”
125332222222221122.title: From Bad to Worse

1253322222222212.content:
Salli and Allen soon gave Carina her order and then served Mia Maza. Mia was a fat wereleopard handiwoman with a mechanical arm. Mia was the main woman Patty, Salli and Pam hired when something was broken. Before Mia could bite into her pizza, she had to cover her ears as Carina was about to speak out. "NOW THIS IS WHAT I'M TALKING ABOUT!" The loud mouth gorgon dug into her fries and then took a bite into her burger before her hair devoured it as well and she went back to her fries. However, after Mia ate her fries and her burger, she was ready for her sundae. As she held up the sundae, she saw one of the strange bracelets. “EH!?” Suddenly, the bracelet begun to twitch. Salli turned her head and gasped. “Hey,” said Allen. “Isn’t that one of Neith’s bracelets?” “It is!” yelled Salli.


Suddenly the bracelet flew onto Carina’s wrist and made her grunt before it suddenly tightened and shrank on her wrist. “WHAT THE!?” Patty, Pam, Norman and Wes heard the commotion and ran out. “What happened?!” asked Patty. “Patty!” yelled Salli. “One of you mom’s bracelets flew onto Carina’s wrist.” “Oh no.” Muttered Patty. Suddenly, Carina heard a stretching sound and looked back to see that her butt was getting bigger. “WHAT’S THIS!? WHAT HAPPENED!?” Carina’s already massive butt got so big that the chair beneath her broke and she landed on the floor with a loud thump and caused it to crack while at the same time, tore apart Carina’s pants. Carina’s butt was now even larger than Patty’s own massive rear.” “Whoa!” yelled Norman in shock. Pam even dropped her jaw.


Wes was so surprised that Patty had to keep him from dropping his glasses. “What just happened?!” yelled Allen as he hid behind Salli’s ear. “Carina’s butt just blew up! It makes Patty’s look small.” “Like I said,” said Patty. “These bracelets are only meant to be worn by a werehippo. Any other type of monster who wears them with be forced to compromise because the manacles give them the body shape of a werehippo, that is to say...” Patty slapped her enormous rear just to accentuate her point. “Wait,” said Salli. “You mean to tell me that whoever wears the manacles gets a butt as big as yours or Neith’s? That’s crazy.” Norman let out a scoff. “All we have to do is pull that sucker off.” Pam gave a snort and grabbed hold of the bracelet and tried to tug it with all her might but it wasn’t budging. Norman ran down his wife’s hand and then tugged as well but still nothing worked. “Dang,” said Pam. “That thing is stuck tight.”

 Mia rolled her eyes and then pulled on Salli’s tail. As Salli turned around, Mia handed her a crowbar. “Oh,” said Salli. “Thanks Mia.” However, as Salli tried to pry off Carina with the crowbar, all it succeeded in doing was making Carina scream. “SALLI! When she initially put on weight by stuffing herself with donuts, she was oblivious to how big her butt was and still was to this day. But while her butt was enormous even before the bracelet hit. In seconds, it was one head taller than she was, including her neck.

Salli and Pam flew forward and saw what was going on and Salli trumpeted loudly. "Oh no!" she yelled. "Lapis has the bracelet on!" Pam gave a squeal and flew down, landing feet first on Lapis's rear as the magnet pulled on the bracelet. "Lapis!" yelled Pam. "Get rid of that bracelet!" Lapis gave a glare as her red-violet unitard was shredded to pieces and she was stuck in her green and black under-unitard. "You think I wouldn't if I could?" asked the Loch Ness woman. "This thing's stuck tight like a lobster's claw. I catch lobsters for a living so I think I know what I'm talking about. Whoa!" Lapis was pulled further and caused Pam to fall off of her as Norman fell off of Pam's shoulder and was forced to grab Lapis's short and stubby tail, pressing his feet against the water giantess's butt cheeks.

Patty finally caught up to her sisters-in-laws and panted as she held her chest from running so much. Since she couldn't fly like Pam or Salli or even drive, it took some effort for her to run down the street. "I'm out of shape," muttered the hippopotamus giantess to herself. "Wes, remind me to take my laundry off of the treadmill when I get home." Wes nodded his head. "Promise me you'll wear the Pack uniform when you run." "Patty," said Allen. "Norman is stuck to Lapis's tail and the bracelet is stuck to Lapis." Patty let out a groan and then slapped herself in the front of her snout. "Of course it did. Damn jewelry." Salli gave a trumpet. "Since's heading to Trini's lab!"

Lapis kept on involuntarily running to Trini's lab just as Crescent was walking towards the laboratory, steamed and holding onto her mithril bra to keep it from flying off. "When I get my hands on that sabertooth," muttered Crescent complaining about her wife's insane contraptions. "I'm going to...!! Huh?" Crescent turned her head and saw Lapis coming up to her. "Oh no." She grumbled. "CRASH!" Lapis had ran into Crescent and her massive booty knocked the werewolf woman into the air, causing her to land breasts first into a shopping cart that was also dragged by the magnet. Crescent growled as she struggled to free herself.

In Trini's lab at the time, the magnet was weakening and Carina held her wrist in pain. Her butt was still as big as ever and the bracelet was not going to come off anytime soon. “TRINI!” shouted Carina. “GET ME OFF THIS CRAZY THING! IT AIN’T WORKING!” Trini smiled nervously. “Like I said, Carina,” said the sabertooth tiger giantess. “The magnet has to wear off on its....” “THUNK!” Trini and Carina turned their heads and saw Lapis stuck in the door and wearing the second hippo queen bracelet. Lapis gave a grumble as she was stuck. “Lapis?” asked Trini. There was another crashing noise and outside, Crescent’s shopping cart had crashed into Lapis’s massive ass and Crescent fell out as Norman fell and landed in the wolf woman’s cleavage. “Oh no.” said Norman right as he sunk into the depths and Crescent got up. “Trini Leary Howler-Grunewald!” yelled the wolf woman to her wife. “I’m going to... huh?!”

Lapis’s massive Loch Ness monster behind had taken up the entire doorway and then some. “Oh no,” said Crescent. “Trini. What happened now?” Trini walked up to Lapis’s head as the fisherwoman Loch Ness Monster gave a glare. “Well,” said Trini. “I’d say Lapis is stuck in our front door.” Lapis gave a scoff. “Trini,” she said. “I’m not fat like you are.” Carina gave a scoff. “YOU’RE MORBIDLY OBESE, YOU STUPID CRYPTID! YOU WERE MORBIDLY OBESE EVEN BEFORE THAT BRACELET MADE YOUR BUTT EVEN MORE GINORMOUS THAN IT ALREADY IS! I DON’T HAVE TO PUT UP WITH THIS FOOLISHNESS! I’M GETTING OUT OF HERE! OOF! HEY! WHAT HAPPENED!?”

Carina foolishly tried to exit through the back door but her butt got stuck in the way and Trini had to walk up and feel the massive gorgon booty and poke it. “Hmm. This is an odd situation. Especially considering these are the only two doors in the house that lead to the outside and they’re both plugged. Hmmm.” Carina and Lapis both let out a groan. "OF ALL THE STUPIDITY!" groaned Carina. "WHY DID I DO THAT!? WHY DID I DO THAT?!" “Well,” said Lapis. “You had better get me out of here fast. I have fish to fry. Literally.” Crescent let out a sigh as she reaches into her cleavage and then grabs Norman, to her surprise. “Norman?” she asks. “What are you doing in my cleavage? Pam will skin you alive.” Norman let out a sigh. “It’s a long story.” Crescent reached into her cleavage again to take out her cell phone.

What happens now?
125332222222221211122.title: The Snake and the Sea Serpent

125332222222221212.content:
Carina decided that since the bracelet on her wrist was magic, then it would be a good idea to fight fire with fire. Namely, she decided to look to Una Pride, a 1000ft tall Nemean Lion witch doctor. Una was very apple-shaped with indigo colored fur and gold and auburn-colored hair that was worn in a beehive hairdo that ended in a ponytail. For clothing, she wore a bikini made out of the skeletons of dinosaurs. At that moment, Una was humming ancient and mystical gibberish as she was drawing a strange circle in the ground. Carina was about to shout and interrupt the lioness but Una held out her hand and stopped her. “I know why you have come.” Said Una. Carina was about to speak but Una placed a seal over Carina’s mouth to stop her from saying anything in her decidedly non-indoor voice, prompting Una to let out muffled yells.

Una looked at the Egyptian-style bracelet around Carina’s wrist and then nodded her head. “This is the bracelet of Queen Tontepsut, the werehippopotamus monarch of millennia past to whom Cleopatra Round is related to through blood. I heard that the queen’s mummified remains were just added to the new Egyptian wing of the Direopolis museum. Rather fascinating. The curse of the bracelets state that only werehippos may wear them and any other monster will develop the physique of a werehippo.” Carina glared at Una and continued to mumble. “I can understand your intentions,” said Una. “You want me to remove the bracelet. Allow me to finish the preparations and I will be able to take it off.” Carina rolled her eyes and took a seat that overflowed Una’s couch before she watched as Una walked up to her refrigerator and took out several ingredients necessary for her spell. “The scales of a 100-year-old naga,” said Una. “Graveyard mold from the queen’s sarcophagus, an unfertilized pterodactyl egg and finally, the tears of a Nile crocodile.” Una mixed the ingredients together until they turned into a thick fog and then she took out a brush to paint the inside of the circle as she hummed to herself.

- - - - - - -

While Una and Carina were dealing with the first bracelet, Patty was walking towards her own house with the second bracelet. She was carrying it in her cleavage to make sure nobody could pull it out as Wes was sitting on her right ear. “Doesn’t your mom own any jewelry that’s not cursed?” asked Wes to his hippopotamus wife. “Most ancient Egyptian jewelry is cursed, Wes,” said Patty. “It’s a security measure.” “Well,” said Wes. “What if we returned the bracelets to the hippo queen. Her remains are on display in the museum.” “No way,” said Patty. “These bracelets are a family heirloom. Mom would flay me if I got rid of them.” As Patty and Wes were walking down the street, three of Neo Neapolitan’s customers passed them.

The first was the elderly yet large-bellied 785ft tall werecheetah, Gardenia Vile who decided to give Patty her own opinion on the bracelet. “If I were you, Patty,” said Gardenia. “I would place that bracelet somewhere where a thief wouldn’t get to it.” Wes gave a glare at Gardenia but Patty was more civil. “Where would you recommend it?” “Well,” said Gardenia. “Certainly not the refrigerator. I heard that 50 years ago, somebody tried placing a diamond in the freezer to hide it and the thief still wound up stealing it by accident by swallowing it.” “Are you saying that I hide it in the bathroom? Because my mother-in-law keeps a jewelry box hidden under the bathroom sink.” “That’s also problematic,” said Gardenia. “Not all burglars can hold it in. And don’t even think about burying it. The new dirt would raise suspicion. I’d recommend hiding the treasure in the fireplace.” “Thanks, Gardenia,” said Patty. “You’re a big help.” However, Wes just gave a suspicious look at Gardenia as she walked away.

“She’s just telling you where to hide the bracelet so she knows where it is.” “Oh, Wes,” grunts Patty. “Knock it off. Gardenia is a sweet old lady who wouldn’t hurt a fly.” “That sweet old lady is Black Spot. I know it.” A long time ago, the monster world was plagued by a female cat burglar known only as Black Spot. She was able to break into even the most impossible to crack security systems and steal anything valuable, usually just to prove that she could. However, Black Spot mysteriously stopped appearing 100 years ago and nobody knows why. From the only photographic evidence of Black Spot, it was clear that she was a feline monster of some kind. While it was too dark to get a good idea, she seemed to be a werecheetah. Since Gardenia Vile was old enough to have lived during the time when Black Spot ran amok, Wes suspected that Gardenia was Black Spot. Gardenia knew about this suspicions and neither confirmed nor denied she was Black Spot. It was unclear if she actually was Black Spot or if she was simply messing with people. Patty of course, didn’t believe Wes’s accusations.

“I’m serious, Patty. Her surname is VILE. That should tell you something.” Patty gave a snort before she grunted as she bumped into somebody else. “Ugh!” Before Patty realized who she bumped into, she checked her cleavage to make sure the bracelet was still in place and gave a sigh of relief. “I’m really sorry about that, Mrs. Round.” Said a young voice. Patty looked and saw that she had bumped into Akira Oda, an 18-year-old Japanese dragon who was a regular customer. Akira was a very fat bright violet-skinned dragoness with a yellow underbelly. Today, Akira’s hair was bright blonde. Every 3 days, Akira dyed her hair a different color. Because of that, nobody knew her natural hair color and Akira herself had forgotten as well. “Oh,” said Patty. “No problem, Akira.” Patty looked at Akira and noticed that she was carrying a package filled with hair care products and tools. “Someone’s having a busy week at the salon.”

Akira nodded her head. “Mom left me in charge while she’s visiting her sick cousin.” Akira and her mother ran the town hair salon. Because they were so busy, they always ordered takeout rather than sitting in Neo Neapolitan to enjoy a meal. Nobody in town knew what Mrs. Oda looked like except that she was even bigger and fatter than her daughter. It was unknown if she was even a dragon and it didn’t help that Mrs. Oda had her customers blindfolded before she worked on them. “Well,” said Wes. “Good luck, Akira. Patty will be in for her haircut in a few days.” Akira walked away and Patty and Wes let out a laugh. “By the way, Akira,” said Patty. “Happy late birthday.” “Thanks, Mrs. Round.” “Oh,” said Wes. “That’s right. Akira just turned 18. I wonder if she’ll get as big as her mom.” “If she does,” says Patty. “Then we’d have an idea what that mountainous anonymous looks like.”

As Patty and Wes were walking forward, they ran into another monster they knew; Christina Sweet, a 1000ft tall ginger-haired and orange-red skinned obese werecrocodile. Christina was the chauffeur to the gargoyle jazz singer, Vienna, who was a friend of Patty’s. Patty gave a nervous look. “Hello, Christina.” She said as she forced a smile. Christina turned her head and then snorted. “Oh. Hi, Patty.” Patty got along okay with Christina but she wasn’t a big fan of crocodiles. In fact, she was afraid of them. Then again, Werehippos and Werecrocs were usually enemies. “I take it Vienna is in town?” asked Wes. “Oh yeah,” said Christina. “We just got back from a tour. By the way, have you added tacos to Neo’s menu yet, huh?” “Not yet, Christina. I’m kind of in a hurry to get home now.” “Okay,” said Christina with a sigh. “I’ll see you later.” Christina’s favorite food was tacos, but unfortunately for her, Neo Neapolitan didn’t sell tacos. “You know, Patty,” says Wes. “With everything else we have on the menu.” “One crisis at a time, Wes.”

- - - - - - -

Meanwhile, Una had finished her magic circle and then pulled Carina up off of the dead couch and instructed her to place the hand in the circle's center. "Now," said the lioness witch doctor. "I shall conduct a spell that will make the bracelet come off." Una was chanting to herself as she played on a strange drum. The spell was making Carina's bracelet twitch and shake. It was certain that the spell would work, but things don't always work the way we want them to. Into the room flew a mosquito the size of a cow and it was buzzing around Carina's head. Carina mumbled but her mouth was still sealed and she couldn't shout. Even with her bracelet twitching, she rose her hand in an attempt to swat the mosquito. This in turn caused magical energy to leave her bracelet and exit out the window.

- - - - - - -

Back at Wes and Patty's house, Patty removed a loose tile from inside of the fireplace just as Gardenia instructed and then took out the bracelet. "I still don't think it's a good idea to hide it in the fireplace." "Come on, Wes. What kind of thief would rob the fireplace. There is no way this nasty bracelet is acting up now." But suddenly, the bracelet in Patty’s hand vanished. “What?!” yelled Patty. “It disappeared!” “Well that’s just ducky.” Groaned Wes.

What the Rounds didn’t know was that the bracelet was teleported and it reappeared on the wrist of...

AREN'T YOU SUPPOSED TO BE ABLE TO SEE THESE THINGS INTO THE FUTURE!" Una just gave a growl that made Carina quiet up.

Carina turned her head and saw all sorts of photographs on the wall of different feline-based monsters, mostly Nemean lions. Una's relatives from the looks of it. The bracelet landed on the wrist of Gardenia Vile and at that moment, the elderly werecheetah was reading the newspaper on the bus and let out a scoff. “Barefoot Bandit?” Gardenia lifted up her enormous belly to get a good look at her own bare feet. “You want a medal for robbing people without wearing shoes? Give me a break. Let’s look at the TV listings. Oh you’ve got to be kidding me? That network only made one good reboot and they pulled its plug while all other attempts to recreate their classics have ended in disasters. Humans have such bad taste, it makes me wonder why they’re considered food to begin with.” Gardenia turned the page on her newspaper, not noticing that her seat on the bus was bending underneath her rear that was now beginning to grow at a rapid rate.

The next article interested Gardenia very much. “The mummy of Queen Tontepsut is on display at the Direopolis museum. Well, Queenie. I haven’t seen your shriveled self for decades. I wonder if you still have that bejeweled death mask.” It was at that point that the bus arrived at Gardenia’s stop. The werecheetah was for some reason having trouble getting up until another monster came up to her. This was Scarlet Leeds, a heavy hourglass-shaped Jersey Devil giantess resembling a pink and white anthropomorphic and demonic quagga. Scarlet grabbed the elderly cheetah woman by her wrists and pulled on her in order to get her back up on her feet. “Oof. Thanks, Scarlet,” said Gardenia. “I guess I’m getting weaker in my old age.” Scarlet couldn’t help but stare at Gardenia’s backside which was now almost as tall as Gardenia herself. “Uh, Ms. Vile,” said the Jersey Devil giantess. “Uh... how do I put this...?” Gardenia just gave a blink and then gave a cough. “I’m sorry, Scarlet,” said Gardenia. “I must be heading home.” With that, Gardenia ran out of the bus in a flash.

Despite being old and fat, Gardenia was still a werecheetah and could move at astonishing speed. Of course, with her enlarged behind, every time she moved around a corner, Gardenia bent a streetlight or damaged a brick wall. “Well,” said Gardenia. “My speed hasn’t diminished in the slightest.” Gardenia then noticed her house up ahead and leapt over the fence. She landed in front of the front door, her larger weight causing one of the cobble stones in the ground leading to the door to crack. Gardenia then held out her claws and used them to pick the lock on her own front door before entering the house. However, she grunted because her butt got stuck in the door. However, she at first blamed it on something else. “I need to cut back on burgers,” said Gardenia. “I’m still fast, but I’d like to get in through my front door. How Nicolette can stand it, I’ll never... whoa!” Gardenia finally pushed herself through the front door and then accidentally sat on and smashed her coffee table.

Gardenia looked back at her large behind in surprise. “Oh my gosh,” she said. “I knew I had a gut, but I don’t remember having the butt of a splintercat. Huh?” Gardenia had finally noticed the bracelet around her wrist. “Now how did I get this? Hmm. It looks like it belongs to Patty. Wait, I’ve seen this before.” Gardenia waddled up to her bookshelf and took out a book. She flipped to an image of a female werehippo with pitch black skin and long red hair. This werehippo woman was dressed as an Egyptian queen and was wearing a variety of gold jewelry, including Neith’s bracelets.

“I though so,” said the werecheetah. “These are definitely the manacles of the werehippo queen. Hmm. Isn’t Patty a descendent of the queen. I certainly don’t recall picking her pocket, though I’m sure that Wes thinks I did. Now, if memories serves, these manacles are cursed. But wait. Where’s the other one? Oh well.”  Gardenia shrugged her shoulders and then turned on the television to an exercise program before she switched into a brown unitard and a red headband with gray leg warmers that miraculously covered her enlarged spotted graying yellow behind. “I think it’s time to switch to the classics.” Thought Gardenia as she started to jump jacks to the exercise program on the television.

Mr. Oda was an albino Japanese dragon with a long gray mustache and long hair. In contrast to his wife and daughter, he was pencil thin. He was also wearing a pair of dark glasses because he was blind. In all the years he had been married to his wife, he had no idea what she looked like. Mr. Oda was listening to an episode of Dr. Madman on the TV via SAP.

“Dr. Madman is in the alphabet soup factory, sticking a butterfly net into the soup where he pulls out several letters and throws them back in one by one.” “C you later. You’ve been D-moted. Y are you in here? I’ve got no use for part timers. O yes. U are coming with me. E what I did there? Hee-hee-hee.” “Mangaga walks in to confront Dr. Madman.” “Dr. Madman! What the heck are you doing?!” “I’m stealing all the vowels from every plant that makes alphabet soup. Now people will have to buy a vowel. Literally! For $100 a can! Ah-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha!” “Mangaga rushes at Dr. Madman only for Madman to toss letters in his face and burn him as he yells. The letters spell out “NERD” as Dr. Madman makes his escape. “You broth that one on yourself Mangaga. Ah-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha!”

Before the cartoon was over, Mr. Oda’s ears twitched and he realized that Akira was walking in. “Hello, Akira.” He said. “Hi, Dad,” said Akira as she took out her supplies. “Did you hear anything from mom about when she’d be back from Tokyo.” “Not yet,” said Mr. Oda. “By the way, how are your horns coming in.” Akira looked into the mirror and saw that she was growing a pair of bright yellow horns. “They’re coming in nicely, Dad. I’m now officially an adult with horns like these.” But then, Akira heard a ripping sound. “Huh?” she asked.
