All your weight normally goes into your stomach.” Akira then gasped and grabbed the sides of her face. “I’m turning into my mom!” Akira had still not realized she was wearing Neith’s bracelet and assumed that because her mother was so titanically huge, it was her DNA to blame for her butt expanding to such an enormous size. Akira even pressed her butt against the mirror and blushed. “Well,” said Mr. Oda. “It’s a surefire sign that you’re an adult dragon.” Akira bit her nails and then felt her horns. “Dragons can live for a very, very, very, very, very long time. But I had no idea that we grew up this fast.” Akira let out a sigh and then she heard the phone ringing.

“Hello?” asked Akira as she answered the phone. “Hi, Sweetie,” said Mrs. Oda on the other line in a soft voice that didn’t match such a titanically huge creature. “How’s everything at home?” “Mom! Oh. I think your genes are catching up with me.” “How so, Akira?” Akira bit her lip. “My butt is titanic. I mean, it’s nearly as big as yours.” “What? But you only just turned 18. You shouldn’t get a mom butt before you’re even a mom.” “Well, I do.” “Hmmm,” said Mrs. Oda. “What?! Oh, ratzafratz! I missed my train! Sorry, dear. But I won’t be in Direopolis until next week. Please hold down the fort until then.” “Will do, Mom.” “And don’t worry. It’s perfectly natural. Love you. Bye.” As Mrs. Oda hung up, she had no idea exactly how wrong she was.

Akira let out a sigh and then noticed Neith’s bracelet on her arm. However, she had no idea it was responsible for her growing backside. “Where did I get this bracelet?” “What bracelet?” asked Mr. Oda. Akira looked closer at the bracelet. “Huh,” she said. “This looks Egyptian. The only Egyptian monsters in town are Principal Necron and Mrs. Round. Oh. I bumped into Mrs. Round. The bracelet must’ve gotten stuck to me. When she comes in for her haircut, I’ll give it back to her. Huh. My butt is probably even bigger than Mrs. Round’s by now.” “That’s quite an achievement as Mrs. Round is a werehippo,” said Mr. Oda before his ears twitched. “It sounds like we have a customer coming.” 

Akira turns her head and into the salon walks...

The railing around Vienna's neck was built to resemble sheet music.

As Christina opened the door, there was piano music playing for Vienna was at work. By trade Vienna was a singer and as such, she was also skilled with virtually any instrument to the point where she had a collection of them kept in her house. The gargoyle giantess was playing the piano so rapidly that Christina could hear it from the other side of the house. The sunlight from the stained glass windows reflected off of Vienna's tiara and shined upon several strangely colored ferns in the corner. Christina walked down the hallway that was covered in oil paintings of monster women, some of which were even naked, unknowing of her booty that was getting bigger and tearing apart her khaki pants. Vienna kept playing the music as Christina’s pants were beginning to slip off. The orange-skinned reptilian giantess made her way into the kitchen and turned on the frying pan. Once the pan was hot enough, Christina puts some steak on the pan and started to flip it as she took out some tomatoes with rice. Then, she walked up to a cupboard that was under lock and key. That cupboard was actually the refrigerated safe where Vienna kept her cheese. Vienna had somewhat an obsession with cheese, that was believed to be because she had Lactose Overload Syndrome. As Christina was busy cooking dinner, her butt grew at such a rapid rate that it was pushing up her long ginger hair and her tail looked like it was shrinking. In the other room, Vienna’s playing became much faster as Christina took out some tortillas and was getting ready to finish.

When Vienna struck the final note, she opened up her wings and her eyes glowed bright red. “I thought you came back to Direopolis to relax until you had to get back to work.” Said Christina as she walked in with a plate full of quesadillas. Vienna let out a sigh and smiled before stuffing her face with three cheese-filled quesadillas at once. Christina ate a couple herself. “Thanks, Christina,” said Vienna as she was licking cheese off her claws. “You make a better quesadilla than Patty. Uh, just don’t tell her I said that.” Christina ate another quesadilla, only for the cheese to leak out all over her purple tanktop. “Damn!” Christina then looked and saw that the cheese splattered on her left thigh. She looked down and gasped at how big her butt had gotten.

Vienna turned and looked in surprise as Christina’s butt was even bigger than her breasts. “Oh my gosh. What happened, Christina?” “I don’t know!” yelled Christina. “What’s the sitch? I knew I was heavy but not that heavy.” Vienna then noticed the bracelet on Christina’s arm and inspected it. “Where did you get that bracelet?” “Bracelet?” asked Christina. “What...?! Huh!?” Christina looked at the bracelet on her list and Vienna realized what it was. “That bracelet belongs to Patty’s mother. It must be what made your behind so enormous.” Christina let out a groan. “First the monkey tattoo and now this?” she asked with a groan. “Great.” “Don’t be snappy.” Said Vienna. “I’m a crocodile, Vienna. I can’t help it.” Vienna walked up to the phone to contact Patty. “I should have her right... achoo!”

As Vienna sneezes, she presses a button by her phone to one of her contacts.

12533222222222122.content:
Back in the kitchen, Patty was dialing the numbers on her phone while Mia was applying bacon grease to Carina’s butt to help her get out of the door. The gorgon’s snakes hissed angrily as Mia was applying the grease. “And I thought my cousin Janet was pear-shaped,” said the wereleopard with a giggle. “If she saw you, she’d have quite a hissy fit.” One of Carina’s snakes nearly bit Mia for that remark. “HISSY FIT! YOU KNOW, THAT’S NOT THE RIGHT CHOICE OF WORDS WHEN YOU’RE TALKING TO A GORGON, YOU DUMB ONE-ARMED, GARGOYLE-RAISED PUDDY TAT!” “CARINA!” yells Patty. “SHUT UP!” Patty let out a sigh as she was getting ready to call her mother. “I better let mom know where her bracelets are.”


Norman was laughing himself silly before speaking to Wes. “Looking at Carina, Big Bro, I’d say her butt is bigger than your wife’s.” Wes gives a glare. “Well at least my wife’s brain is bigger than your wife’s.” Pam gives an angry snort at that. “Want me to stick you up my snout, Wes?” “Pam!” yells Patty as she shows her enormous fangs. “Be quiet! Ah, I’m getting a signal.” However, it wasn’t Patty’s mother that answered but her human father, Carter. “Cleopatra?” asked the old man on the phone. “What are you calling us for?” “Dad? I was looking for Mom. She forgot her bracelets and one of our customers has one of them stuck to her wrist.” “What?! Are you serious!? Those bracelets belonged to the werehippo queen 3000 years ago.” “I know,” said Patty with a sigh. “And now Carina’s butt is already half as big as the werehippo queen’s and I can’t get it off.” Carter let out a sigh. “Did that filthy hipster you married have something to do with it?” Wes overheard that part and was visibly flustered. “You’re no prize yourself, you old badger.” Thought Wes to himself.


“Wes,” said Patty. “Shut up. Dad, where is Mom? She might know how to get the bracelet off.” Carter let out a sigh. “Neith is busy being a model for a college figure drawing class. We’ll be in Direopolis in the next two weeks. Just don’t let anyone who isn’t a werehippo wear the other bracelet.” Carter hung up and Patty let out a sigh before looking at the second bracelet. “That thing is dangerous. I’m taking it back to the safe in our house.” “Why not just leave it here with us, Patty?” asked Salli. Patty gave a snort. “And leave it alone with you and Pam? I don’t think so.” Pam gave an angry squeal and Salli gave a trumpet. “That’s not fair,” said Pam. “I am surprised at your lack of trust.” “And I’m often surprised at your lack of brains! Remember when I sent you to pick up eggs and you came back with a step-counter dog collar?” “It was a good deal, Patty.” “Oh it was,” says Wes sarcastically. “Now all we need is a dog.” Pam drooped her tusks but Salli stepped forward. “Patty,” she said. “I know Pam is stupid but you can trust me.” Patty gave a snort. “Those bracelets are a Round family heirloom. Only a Round can be trusted with them. I’m taking them and putting them in a safe. Come on Wes.” Patty placed Wes between her breasts as she storms out, squeezing her way past Carina and pushing both of themselves out the front door as Mia bursts into laughter.


The question is, did Patty remember to take the second bracelet?
12533222222222122.title: The Second Bracelet

125332222222221221.content:
Patty at that time had taken the second bracelet in her purse and Wes in her cleavage as she was walking out to return home and place the bracelet in her safe. “So, any more of your mom’s family jewelry that’s cursed?” asked Wes. “Shut up, Wes,” said the werehippo giantess to her tiny husband. “We just have to make sure nobody else wears these things. Only mom knows how to take the stupid bracelets off. The sooner this thing is locked away the better.” Patty waddled up to a bus stop where her naturally humongous butt took up the entire bench. The pink werehippo let out a sigh as she begun to wait.


Unlike Pam who had wings and Salli who could levitate due to her vampire blood, Patty couldn’t fly and what made moving around Direopolis difficult for her was the fact that she had never taken driver’s ed let alone had a license to operate a vehicle. That’s why she needed Pam to be the delivery girl. The werehippo waited for five minutes until another would-be passenger sat next to her. This giantess was Mallory, a turquoise-skinned, cream-haired succubus with oryx-like horns, one red eye, a patch over her left eye and enormous breasts due to having Lactose Overload Syndrome, a disorder that only affects werewolves, succubi and gargoyles. “Oh no,” groaned Wes as he watches Mallory watching Sun Vulcan on her phone. “It’s Mallory.” Patty groaned. Mallory, or Deathina as she preferred to be called, was a would-be super villain out to take over the world. However, the fact was she was more of a nuisance than an actual threat and only ever succeeded in causing trouble for the Rounds, Hockers and Van Richters. “Ignore her, Wes,” muttered Patty. “We have bigger fish to fry.” 
 The bus arrived and Patty and Mallory walked inside. There weren’t too many monsters on the bus but there were two in particular near the back seat that Patty and Wes noticed. First of them was a giant and pear-shaped capricorn woman, a monster who resembled a humanoid indigo furred and blonde-haired goat with a large udder but with gills on her neck and grayish blue fish scales covering her legs. This capricorn was wearing a black mask that covered the top of her face, fingerless gloves, a unitard, a cape and a belt with stockings. She was reading the newspaper article about an evil geneticist who died in a car crash during a police chase. This woman was Wilma Kidd, known mainly as Deneb, a would-be superhero who goes around Direopolis looking for crimes to destroy. Not that there was much crime in Direopolis.


To the side of Wilma there was a pear-shaped and silver-skinned werelizard resembling a hunch-backed chameleon with gray-striped on her back, brown reddish hair in a bobcut and a rainbow colored tongue. She was wearing a white-colored business suit with a skirt and appeared to be yelling into her cell phone at somebody. Her name was Claire Melon and she was one of Neo Neapolitan’s regular customers. She was a businesswoman who ran a chain of hotels around the monster world. She was usually stressed out because the main hotel located in Direopolis was especially problematic. Patty couldn’t make out what Claire was so mad about but decided to ignore it.


The bus took off again and Patty laid down her purse and let out a deep yawn. The bus soon came to another stop but Wes looked out and saw that they were nowhere near the street where he and Patty lived. This was because the bus was picking up another passenger. This passenger was a fat scaly yellow-green-skinned monster resembling a long horned wildebeest with aqua-colored hair. She was wearing a pair of sunglasses along with a mawashi and a basketball shirt. Her name was Ethiopia Gnu, a wildebeest-like monster called a catoplebas and a friend of Deneb’s. She was a recurring customer at Neo Neapolitan and was a rather odd duck. She was constantly trying to perfect a sport that combined basketball and sumo and right now as she walked up and sat next to Patty, she was dribbling a basketball big enough to destroy a human village. “Hey, Patty.” Said Ethiopia. “Hi, Ethiopia.” Said Patty with a sigh. Patty saw the catoblepas spinning her basketball on her finger and rolled her eyes.


The bus soon arrived at Patty and Wes’s house and the Rounds walked to the door. Patty reached into her cleavage and Wes handed her the key. Patty walked up to a painting of a four werehippos tasting wine and revealed a safe behind it before unlocking the secret combination and opening the door to reveal the valuable contents inside. “Nothing is getting out of this safe until Mom gets home.” “Or until we need Mia to fix the sink again.” Said Wes. “Very funny, I...” Patty then noticed that she didn’t have her purse with her. “Wes?” asked the hippo giantess. “Where’s my...?” It was at that moment, Patty realized that she had forgotten her purse on the ride over and it was still on the bus, prompting the giantess to let out a scream of frustration. 

 “Don’t tell me you forgot your purse on the bus with that cursed bracelet in it.” Moaned Wes. “I’m a hippopotamus, not an elephant, Wes! I can’t remember anything! **** my luck!” Patty shut the safe and then ran out hoping she could catch the bus. “Wait!” yelled Patty. “Stop!” But the bus had already driven off. “****!” yelled Wes. Patty let out a sigh. “Some days it doesn’t pay to get out of bed.”


Things were about to get a whole lot worse for Patty and Wes because one of the other passengers on the bus had at that point found Patty’s purse with the cursed bracelets inside. But who?

12533222222222122111.content:
Deneb was just about to leave the bus but then she spotted Patty’s purse. She gave a scowl as she picked up the purse and took it with her as she was leaving the bus. As Deneb held up the purse, the second bracelet twitched in the purse and flew around the capricorn giantess’s wrist. The goddess-sized goat walked down the street, her cape hiding the fact that her already rather large behind was slowly getting larger and stretching her fishnet stockings.

Down the street, Patty was rushing to reach the bus in order to retrieve her purse before anyone could wear the bracelet and be cursed just like Carina. “Can’t you run any faster?” asked Wes. “I thought hippos could run 19MPH Patty snorted as she was running. “Get off my case, Wes.” Wes let out a sigh. “Why didn’t you just take driver’s ed anyway?” Patty grit her teeth and growled at her tiny husband riding in her ear. Wes shook his head. “Might I recommend yoga, Patty? I see you’re flustered. You already have five medicine balls built into your body.” “You know, Wes, you’re not as funny as you think.”

Suddenly, Patty came to a scoff and Wes yelled as he fell into his wife’s ear canal.  As for why Patty stopped running, she ran into Deneb who was holding out her purse. “Your purse, Mrs. Round.” Said Deneb. Patty smiled and took her purse. “Thanks, Deneb. You’re a regular Johnny on the spot. This purse contains dangerous cargo.” Deneb nodded her head, still unaware of the bracelet around her wrist. “I recommend you keep whatever is in this purse under lock and key. What exactly is in it that’s so important?” Patty let out a sigh. “It’s one of my mom’s bracelets. Any non-werehippo who wears the bracelets has their butt swell to enormous size.” Deneb raised an eyebrow because normally her rear was half as big as Patty’s quite massive rear. “Well,” said Deneb. “I’ll just leave you two on your way. Be careful. You have no idea how many evildoers there might be in this very town.” As Deneb went on her way, neither she nor Patty noticed that her fish-scaled goat booty was getting enormous.

Patty shook her head and out into her hand fell Wes, covered in his wife’s earwax. “We’re in luck, Wes,” said Patty. “Deneb found my purse.” Wes grunted. “Good, now let’s get home so we can put that bracelet in the safe and me in the shower.” Sure enough, Patty and Wes returned to their home and Wes was in the kitchen sink washing hippopotamus earwax off of himself as Patty opened the safe revealing several pieces of Egyptian jewelry, a collection of DVDs and a briefcase labeled “Mia Money”. “Now,” said Patty as she reached into her purse. “Time to... what?! Oh no!” “What’s wrong?” asked Wes. “The bracelet isn’t here.” “What?! Where is it, then!?”

At that moment, the bracelet was stuck to Deneb’s wrist, not that Deneb noticed and Deneb’s rear was now twice as big as she was and even wider. However, at that moment, she actually wasn’t patrolling Direopolis and was returning home, somehow unknowingly managing to squeeze her now enormous butt through the front door. However, she still didn’t take off her costume and simply walked into the living room where the windows were obscured by newspaper. Deneb then walked up to a markhor-shaped lamp and opened the head’s mouth to reveal a button inside. By pressing the button, Deneb caused her easy chair to move back and reveal a elevator. Deneb sat down into the easy chair, accidentally destroying it as the cushion slide down the chute. She landed at the bottom and grunted as she landed on her butt with a crashing sound.

However, Deneb sprung up and the goat giantess walked into an underground base of some sort. As Deneb reached the inside of her underground lair, her shadow cast over a table that appeared to have a human-sized model city built on it. She loomed over a model hotel and tapped on the roof. as her butt and udder wobbled. “Adam,” said Deneb. “Are you in there?” Out of the front door of the model hotel came a human boy, one who barely looked older than 10. This young boy was Adam Kidd, Deneb’s adoptive son. However, Deneb didn’t usually take her out of the lair with her due to how inhospitable a monster town can be to humans the size of ants to the creatures of mythology running about.

“Down here, Mom!” yelled Adam up to Deneb. Deneb gave a smile before switching it to her usual grimace. “Not a very eventful day,” said the goat giantess. “Which is what worries me. I’m sure that Deathina is up to something.” Adam let out a laugh as he climbed on his goat mother’s gloved index finger. “Calm down, Mom. Deathina is the closest thing to a super villain Direopolis has. There’s nothing to worry about.” “There’s more to worry about than you know, Adam,” said Deneb as she walked up and hooked her udder up to a machine of some sort. “I only came back from patrol early because it’s that time of the week again. It all comes with being a capricorn. Nobody knows the trouble goat and cow-based monsters have to go through.”

While Deneb was waiting to be milked, she took off her mask and Adam climbed up his mother’s shoulder, only to look back in surprise. Deneb’s butt was now so large that her fishnets looked like they were painted on and her cape and hair were being held up by it. “Uh, Mom,” said Adam. “There’s something you should know...”

Not looking away from her phone, Mallory reached out to grab what she though was her purse, but instead picked up Patty's. The episode of Sun Vulcan she was watching ended, and she finally looked away to see she had grabbed the wrong purse.

"Oops. This isn't mine." She said. She grabbed her actual purse and put Patty's down, but not before taking a quick peek inside. When she did, she saw the bracelet.

"Well, hello." Mallory said, intrigued. "You look magical. Maybe I can use you to further my world-conquering plans." She reached down to grab the bracelet, but before she could, it shot up and latched itself onto her right wrist. Mallory frowned at this.

"Crap!" She said, before attempting to remove the bracelet. But no such luck, it was stuck tight. "Great, it's one of those magic items. This is the third time this month." Unknown to Mallory, her butt had already begun to expand.

The bus stopped in front of Mallory's workplace, an LOS strip club called LOS Lovely's. Mallory got up and started to get off. Her butt was expanding at a rapid pace, so she was already bumping into people on her way off, but she didn't realize it yet. When she got to the door of the bus, her butt got stuck in it. With some effort, she managed to get out.

"Geez, I got through that door earlier. Did it magically shrink on me? Wouldn't be the first time." Mallory muttered as she walked up to the club, still unaware of her inflating butt.

Mallory had managed to get into the club no problem, since the doors were designed with LOS afflicted women in mind. She started for the staff changing room before she heard a wolf whistle. She rolled her eyes at it. She knew who that belonged to.

She turned and saw her coworker, Viveka. She was an indigo succubus with lavender hair, purple eyes, and an exaggerated hourglass figure. Viveka had a huge crush on Mallory, and was always flirting with her, but also flirted with pretty much any monster that walked in.

"Hello there, Mallory." Viveka said. "I must say, you look even sexier today then usual."

Mallory just groaned. "I'm not interested Viveka." She replied.

"Hm. But just look at you. I love what you've done with that gorgeous ass of yours." Viveka purred.

"My ass?" Mallory said, confused. It was then she finally looked back. Her butt had expanded to about her height of 855 feet, and about 1000 feet wide.

"Holy crap!" Mallory yelled. "I look like Beast Tamer Keris times 100!"

Viveka was still staring. "Just look at it. I could use it as a bed."

Mallory whipped her head back. "Do that, and I'm turning you into a glass bowl." She threatened.

Viveka shrugged and walked past her. "Keep my offer in mind." She said, before smacking Mallory's now giant ass, making it wobble.

Mallory face-palmed. "I swear..." She muttered. Then she looked at the bracelet still stuck on her arm. "I'm guessing this is what you do. Didn't think I'd see a body expanding piece of jewelery again after last month. But you usually come in pairs, so where's the other one?" Before she could ponder it, she realized her butt was still wobbling. She frowned, realizing it wasn't going to stop anytime soon.

12533222222222122112121.content:
"HEY! MEMPHIS!" The incredibly loud voice of Carin yelled. "I NEED YOU'RE HELP WITH-" She stopped when she saw Mallory and her giant butt. "WHO THE F**K ARE YOU?"

Mallory was surprised that Carina's butt was just as big as her's, but managed to stop looking at it for a moment. "I am Deathina, and you are annoying. So get your massive butt out of this house. I have business with Ms. Sinai." She said.

"WELL SO DO I! I NEED THIS F**KING BRACELET OFF!" Carina yelled, holding up her arm.

Mallory gasped and bounded over to Carina, knocking over Memphis with her ass. "The other bracelet!" She yelled, grabbing Carina's arm. "Ms. Sinai, remove her bracelet immediatly so I may have it."

"OTHER? THERE'S TWO OF THESE THINGS?" Carina screamed.

"Yes, and I have the other. Why do you think my butt is so big?" Mallory said.

"Unbelivable." Memphis said. "I'm calling Patty. I hope she sorts this out." But before Memphis could pick up the phone...
12533222222222122112121.title: Carina Comes A'Knockin'

choices: The Bracelets Fused Into a Pair of Handcuffs
125332222222221221121212.content:
Suddenly both Mallory and Carina's bracelets begun to vibrate violently. "WHAT THE?!" yelled Carina. "UGH!" Mallory and Carina's arms jumped up in the air as their bottoms wobbled and the bracelets let out a strange energy. Mallory's bracelet was letting out red lightning as Carina's let out blue lightning. Their butts begun to expand again but then the gorgon and the succubus were being pulled towards each other. Memphis saw what was happening and ran to her phone to call Patty. "Why do those Rounds always have to bring trouble?" asked the horse mummy to herself.

At this moment, Patty and Wes were walking out of the bus station and Patty was panting heavily. "I... can't... believe... that... I... ran... all the way... to the (cough)... bus stop and... nobody... nobody turned in the stupid purse with the.... with the bracelet, Wes. Oh geez, I'm out of shape. Either I'm going to have to start jogging everyday or invest in driver's ed." Suddenly, Patty's phone rang and Patty tried to reach for it in her back pocket, only to forget that being a werehippo, her rear end was quite large even without the bracelets and couldn't reach her pocket. "Urgh! Wes, could you answer that." Wes climbed down his wife's red hair and took out the phone and gulped. "Uh-oh. It's from that neighbor of ours. What does she want?" Patty took the phone and put it to her ear.

"Cleopatra!" shouted Memphis. "There's big trouble!" Patty let out a sigh. "Memphis. I returned your lawnmower yesterday." "Not that! A succubus and gorgon are in my house! Fighting over a pair of bracelets! They look like yours!" "What?!" yelled Patty. Patty hung up and started to run back to Memphis's place. "Just our luck!" yelled the irate hippopotamus woman. "We run to the bus station to find Mom's bracelet and it turns out it was right next door to our house! And to top it all off, Mallory just had to be the other one to get hit by the curse!" Patty's phone begun to ring again and Patty groaned as she held up the phone and read the caller ID. "Mom," says Patty as she answers the phone. "I'll have to talk to you later."

At the other end of the phone, Neith was showering underneath a waterfall. "I just forgot to tell you, Patty," said the mother hippopotamus. "In the event that two people each wear one of those bracelets, they must be kept separate. Something awful will happen." Patty grit her teeth. "Are you kidding me?!" Neith shook her head on the other side and walked out from under the waterfall to put her tiara back on. "And whatever you do, make sure nobody wears both of them at once. Love you, bye." Neith hung up and Patty let out a sigh. "We need a way to get back home fast."

Meanwhile, the bracelets pulled Mallory and Carina towards each other and at that moment...
125332222222221221121212.title: From Weird to Worse

1253322222222212212.content: So is it Ethiopia or Claire?
1253322222222212212.title: Ethiopia or Claire

12533222222222122121.content:
On the bus, Ethiopia was still spinning her basketball on her finger when she noticed Patty’s purse. The wildebeest-like giantess monster moved her shaggy aqua hair and adjusted her sunglasses to get a good look at what she saw. “Great Malone’s ghost,” said Ethiopia. “Looks like Patty forgot her purse. I better let that werehippo know that it’s missing. Hey, what’s this?” Ethiopia noticed the bracelet and let out a scoff as she rolled her eyes. “Must be more of her flashy Egyptian gold jewelry. That hippopotamus and her mother wear more of this junk than a mummified queen. It’s a fashion disaster.” “This coming from a catoblepas who regularly wears a basketball tanktop with a mawashi?” asked a male werebear on the bus who was reading the funny papers. Ethiopia gave a glare. “If looks could kill,” said the catoblepas. “Come to think about it, if it weren’t for these sunglasses, my looks COULD kill. Oh well.” Ethiopia stepped out of the bus and carried Patty’s purse with the bracelet in it as she walked up towards her house.

Ethiopia’s house was a rather oddly decorated house. For one thing, it had a sumo ring in the back of it with a basketball net over her garage. There was also a garden of mushrooms of different varieties (catoblepi just loved mushrooms, especially poison mushroom since they could make their breath poisonous as well), a koi pond that was guarded by a brightly colored wire dome and the flags for France, Russia, Kenya, America and Japan hanging from the roof like a clothesline. The inside of the house looked even stranger as there was a display rack with a collection of exotically designed basketballs, a floor that was designed to look like a jigsaw puzzle and a television that was hung over the fireplace. Ethiopia also had a display case with novelty soda cups and a collection of cans, to say nothing of a shelf with wrestling and basketball trophies decorating it.

Ethiopia walked up to her front door and reached into her mawashi to take out the key. She unlocked the door and walked inside. “I’m ho-ome!” shouted the catoblepas giantess as she walked inside. Ethiopia bent over to look around the floor, lifting up her stomach in order to get a better look. She took a step forward and was about to bring her foot down when she heard somebody yell “Stop!”. Ethiopia looked down to the floor and spotted a young Japanese man her age dressed in a red and white basketball jersey and shorts. The human was dangerously close to being stepped on by the catoblepas giantess. Ethiopia gave a snort and then picked up her human mate and let out a scoff. “Masao,” she said. “I told you to be careful. You’re not indestructible like Patty, Salli and Pam’s husbands.”

Masao just let out a nervous laugh as his wife smiled at him with her sharp teeth. “So how did it go?” he asked Ethiopia. Ethiopia let out a sigh. “Well, I’ve got 11 volunteers for my basketball class and 8 for my sumo class, but absolute 0 for both at once. It’s going to be tougher to combine the two sports than I thought.” Masao nodded his head as he stood on his wife’s finger. “I see,” he said before he noticed Patty’s purse. “Uh, what are you doing with Patty’s purse?” Ethiopia put her husband on her shoulder and then she stepped up towards her telephone. “She forgot it on the bus. I’m going to call her to tell her that I have it.” Masao nodded his head. “Well that’s great. By the way, are Pinky and Deneb available for game night.” Ethiopia picked up the phone to dial the number and then let out a sigh. “Deneb is going to be late. Apparently somebody called her to tell her they were going to rob a vending machine near the playground.”

Ethiopia held up the telephone to her ear and waited for Patty to answer. “Hello?” asked Patty on the other end of the phone. “This really isn’t a good time to call.” “Hello,” said Ethiopia. “Patty. I found your purse on the bus and I’d like you to know it’s at my place.” “What?!” yelled Patty on the other line. “Ethiopia, whatever you do, don’t put on the bracelet in that purse.” Ethiopia gave a scoff. “Are you kidding me?” asked Ethiopia. “I wouldn’t put on that ugly thing if you paid me. The only jewelry I ever wear is my wedding ring.” “This isn’t a joke, Ethiopia,” said Patty. “If you wear that bracelet, it will make your butt expand to the point where it’s bigger than you are.” Ethiopia broke out in laughter. “Patty, you can’t be serious. And hello, I’m a sumo wrestler. Like a bigger butt would bother me? What are you afraid my ass will get bigger than yours?” “Listen you wacky wildebeest,” said Patty in an angrier tone. “Carina the gorgon already wore that bracelet and now she’s ginormous. Be careful.” Ethiopia let out a sigh. “You’re such a worry wart,” she said, not realizing that the bracelet was already shaking in Patty’s purse and repositioning itself towards the catoblepas’s wrist. “Well, while I’m on the phone, I’d like to order some dinner for me and my husband. We’ll take a large pizza with feta cheese, spinach, tomatoes, black olives and oregano. Thank you.”

Ethiopia hung up the phone and then Masao tugged on her ear. “Ouch. Masao!” “Ethiopia,” said Masao to his enormous wife. “Is it just me or is that bracelet moving.” Ethiopia grunted in confusion and then spotted the bracelet twitching. “What the? Yikes!” Without warning, the bracelet clung to Ethiopia’s wrist and tightened itself. This in turn caused Ethiopia to drop her sunglasses, which shattered on the ground, forcing her to close her eyes to avoid petrifying Masao as she screamed. “Ethiopia!” yelled Masao. “Don’t look at my eyes! They’re unprotected! You’ll turn to stone!” Masao instead looked at Ethiopia’s butt that was already expanding and knocked over their coffee table. “Uh, Ethiopia,” he said. “It looks like Patty was right.” Ethiopia let out a grumble and then there was a knock on the door. “Crap,” muttered the wildebeest giantess. “I can’t answer the door in this condition. It’s unlocked! Come inside!”

  The door opened and in walked...
12533222222222122121.title: Booty and the Wildebeest

12533222222222122122.content:
On the bus, Claire was still arguing on the phone. “Listen here,” said the chameleon giantess as she grit her teeth. “You’re treading on thin ice. I am warning you, you are making a powerful enemy. I am going to tell everyone around Direopolis that you are an incompetent halfwit who couldn’t put together a gazebo if you had the blueprints tattooed to your body! I should’ve just hired Trini! I can’t believe that even Pam would recommend an a-hole like you!” As Claire hung up, she let out a yell of frustration. “It’s people like those who are what’s wrong with the.... huh?”

Claire noticed Patty’s purse right next to her and then picked it up. Before she spoke, Claire noticed a dragonfly flying overhead and flicked out her tongue to pull it into her mouth, chew it like bubblegum and swallow it. “This is Patty’s purse. She must’ve left it on the bus. I’ll just take this to the hotel’s lost and found.” Claire then held up her cell phone and went to her day planner before typing “Call Patty” and “Return Purse” onto her to-do list. Suddenly the phone begun to ring because Claire got another call and then answered it.

“Hello?” asked Claire. “Calm down, Xandra. I can barely hear you. What!? Oh no, he ****ing didn’t. I’m really sorry, but if I were you, I’d call that San Francisco lawyer, Kate Rowling. She’d destroy him. Excuse me? And why should I get married? Give me one good reason. Xandra, you can’t be serious. I’m not mother material. Besides, have you seen the size of my butt? I can’t sit on an egg. I’d break it. Get off my case. A lot of girls stuff themselves when they get stressed out.” As Claire was busy yammering away, she didn’t notice that the second hippo queen bracelet was shaking in Patty’s purse and sensed Claire’s wrist nearby. The bracelet flew onto Claire’s wrist and squeezed itself tight until it was too tight to be removed before it started to glow. Claire was so busy speaking on the phone that she failed to notice the bracelet and she also failed to notice that her already huge and fat booty was expanding in size.

The chameleon giantess let out a sigh and then noticed she had come to her stop. “I’ll talk to you later. I just have to go and inspect the weak link in my hotel chain.” The 875ft tall lizard woman placed her phone in her pocket and got up out of her bus seat. While her butt was already wider than she was tall, it had gotten so big that her mere motions broke the back of the bus seat. As Claire moved towards the front of the bus, her larger than usual Italian skirt wearing booty was pressing against the seats on both sides of the bus. At several points, she unknowingly whacked several other monster passengers in their faces and made them yelp. “Ow!” yelled one werewolf girl as Claire hit her in the cheek with a butt cheek. “Watch where you’re going, fat ass!”

Claire turned her head and gave a hiss at the wolf girl as she was about to step out the bus door. However, because her backside was expanding at a rapid rate, the moment she tried to climb out, the chameleon lady got stuck and grunted as she grit her teeth and tried to shake herself free. The green and slimy ectoplasmic ghost bus driver turned his head and gasped before he started to try and push Claire out the door, pressing his green translucent hands against Claire’s planetary butt cheeks. “I told the bus company to make those doors bigger,” thought Claire to herself as she grit her teeth. “Of course, it’s my own fault since my diet is 75% donuts, humans and insects. Starting tomorrow, I’m cutting back on the scorpions. Ugh!” The bus driver finally managed to shove Claire’s titanic butt through the door and Claire landed with a heavy pratfall outside the Direopolis Rainbow Tongue Hotel. Claire’s butt was so big that the entire ground beneath her cracked apart and the cracks seeped into the road.

Claire stood up as the bus drove away and then took out her compact mirror to apply a fresh sheet of lipstick. The chameleon giantess was so busy tending to her face that she didn’t notice that her ass was 2000ft tall and 3000ft wide. It was so big that the only thing covering it were her Jurassic Park undies. Unfortunately, the chameleon woman closed her make up mirror before she could see just how extremely pear-shaped she had become and then took out her cellphone to text Patty as she was walking up to her hotel to inspect the place. Of course, the text that Patty sent back confused Claire. "Whatever you do, Don't wear the bracelet? Bracelet? What bracelet? I didn't see a bracelet in the purse. Ugh. I have enough to worry about without crazy hippos."

As Claire walked into the hotel, her booty jiggled and shook with each step, not noticing that people were staring. The Frankenstein’s monster doorman spotted Claire and looked in shock at his boss’s more massive than normal hindquarters. Though he didn’t say anything and just opened the door, not wanting to risk his job. Of course, Claire still noticed that her doorman was staring and raised one of her bulging cross eyes. “Is there a problem, Khary?” The Frankenstein shook his head and then detached his jaw to stow away in his pocket to prevent himself from saying anything that could and would get him into trouble. Claire just rolled her eyes. “Weirdo.” She thought to herself. As Claire walked into the lobby, she grunted and begun to slouch, not realizing it was because her growing booty was wreaking havoc on her spine.

“Geez,” thought the chameleon woman. “My back is killing me. All this stress must be affecting my body. Oh no. I’m not calling that chiropractor that Pam recommended. He’d probably turn my spine into a Picasso. I learned my lesson from those ****ing contractors. It would be easier if I just called two of my human employees to my office and had them work on my joints. At least humans can be useful, unlike some monsters I can name.” While it was true that Claire was a monster that ate humans, she sometimes hired them as employees. Any human that worked for Claire was in no danger of being chameleon bait.

Claire then walked up to the manager of the hotel and her mere presence intimidated her. The manager was an obese female wendigo with white fur over her body, a deer-like nose, razor sharp teeth and short pink hair. Unlike others of her kind, this wendigo didn't have horns. "Ms. Melon?" asked the wendigo. "What are you doing here so early?" "Rebecca," said Claire to the wendigo. "You do recall that the Ambassador of Neo Lemuria is going to be in town, right?” “Yes, Ms. Melon.” Said Rebecca as she stared at the chameleon lady’s monstrous rear that was at this point even larger than its owner. “Well,” said Claire. “He’s staying at the Rainbow Tongue Hotel and I don’t want any monkey business. Their stay is to be perfect.” Rebecca heard what Claire was saying but couldn’t help but stare at Claire’s ass and desperately tried to change the subject. “Doesn’t the ambassador have a fetish for reptilian monster girls, Ma’am.” “Don’t you start that too. I want this hotel to be in perfect shape for when they come. We can’t afford any foul ups.”

As Claire was continuing to speak, she noticed that crawling across the ground was a house centipede that was the size of a train to humans. The massive lizardess flicked out her rainbow-colored tongue and swallowed the centipede whole on the spot. She then turned to face Rebecca. “That centipede that I just ate,” she said. “That is the only bug I want to see in this hotel for a while. Everything must be perfect for the arrival of the ambassador, Rebecca. Do I make myself clear?”

The wendigo’s mind was elsewhere, namely on her boss’s enormous booty. “Rebecca!” yelled Claire startling the manager of her hotel. “Am I clear?!” Rebecca was startled but cleared her throat. “As clear as the ass under your tail, boss.” Claire gave a shocked look and then gave a glare. “Excuse me?” the chameleon businesswoman asked. Rebecca bit her lip. “Your ass, Ms. Melon,” she said. “It’s bigger than usual. It’s more than twice your height.” Claire flicked out her tongue and slapped Rebecca in the cheek as she grunted. “I’d be really careful about what I say if I were you, Rebecca. Urgh!” Claire felt her back again and groaned. “I’ll be in my office. Please be a dear and send up two of our human employees, I don’t care which ones, and tell them that I’ll pay them extra if they can do something about this back pain I’ve been having." With that, Claire walked up to the elevator and got inside. It took some effort because of the size of her rear but she managed to squeeze inside, still oblivious to how big her ass had gotten. The elevator was moving slowly as Claire's booty took up the entire thing. The chameleon woman grunted as she tried to reach down for her cell phone. "Great," she muttered. "What is with this elevator? I thought I made it clear that they were to be cleared for monsters as big as gargoyles."

While Claire was struggling, Carina was down the street grumbling to herself. Her butt was so big at this point that the gorgon's upper body was completely unseeable from the back. "OF ALL THE ROTTEN LUCK! TRINI AND CRESCENT HAD TO CHOOSE NOW TO GO ON A SECOND HONEYMOON! AND TO TOP IT OFF, UNA'S SICK WITH THE FLU! HOW DOES A WITCH DOCTOR GET SICK! I DIDN'T WANT TO HAVE TO GO TO... THEM... BUT WHAT CHOICE DO I HAVE NOW! DAMN BRACELET! THIS IS YOUR FAULT! I JUST HOPE THEY'RE IN TOWN, UNLIKE A CERTAIN SABERTOOTH I KNOW!"
12533222222222122122.title: Chameleon Caboose

choices: Patty and Wes Reach the Hotel First
125332222222221221222.content:
It wasn’t long until Rebecca sent two of the Rainbow Tongue’s human employees to tend to Claire’s back problem; specifically a young man and a woman. “What do you think Ms. Melon wants, Brenda?” asked the young man. “Oh my gosh. Do you think she found out about that washing machine that we broke.” The young woman gave a scoff. “Relax, Craig. That thunder-thighed dinosaur doesn’t have eyes in the back of her head and even if she did, her hunch back and massive booty would obscure them.” “Brenda,” said Craig. “She’s still our boss. Don’t be so nasty. Working for a giant monster means we’re safe from monsters that would eat us.” “Hello, Craig! She eats humans too!” “Not humans that work for her.” Craig and Brenda walked into the human-sized elevator in order to make it to Claire’s office. “Hey,” said Brenda. “I don’t know about you. But I’m not going to be the slave to Godzilla’s fashion challenged ex-wife for the rest of my life. Once I have the capital I need to put the Black Top in motion, I’m going to tell Claire to stick it.”

Craig rolled his eyes as they reached the floor where Claire’s office was. “You know, putting extra stress on Claire isn’t a good idea. She’s already pretty unstable as it is. Besides, I’d say she’s a decent person to work for.” “Decent person to work for? Craig, she’s a literal monster.” “I don’t think she’s so bad.” “Just the other day, she screamed at me just because I was late for work and told me that I’d be fired if it happened again.” “Brenda, you were 2 HOURS late for work. That would make any boss mad.” “Well,” said Brenda. “One of these days, I’m going to tell that chameleon...” Before Brenda could say another word, she had to stop in her tracks to avoid being stepped on by a werehyena maid that had just finished tidying a guest’s hotel room. “Watch where you’re going, moron!” yelled Brenda up to the large maid. The hyena giantess glared down at Brenda before Craig waved his arms at her. “She didn’t mean it, Juliet! Honest!” Fortunately for Brenda, Juliet had work to do and stomped away to clean the next room. “Brenda,” said Craig. “That wasn’t that nice. You know Juliet has bad eyesight.” “That thing nearly killed us! And what’s the idea calling her by her name?” “She’s our coworker.” “She’s a hyena!” “Listen. Let’s agree to disagree. Ms. Melon won’t like it if we keep her waiting too long.” Craig went ahead as Brenda rolled her eyes. “I was getting my nails done the other day. So eat me.”

Craig and Brenda reached the door to Claire’s office and walked under it. “Low,” said Claire. “Devon. Where are you two?” “Down here, Ms. Melon!” shouted Craig. “You called.” “Yes, I did,” replied Craig with a groan. “My back is killing me. I don’t even know why.” Brenda gave a scoff. “See what I mean,” she whispered to Craig, making sure that Claire couldn’t hear her. “She only called us in here for a massage.” Craig then blew on his finger. “I am willing to pay you overtime for this.” Said Claire. “Right on it, ma’am.” Said Brenda changing her tone. That was when Brenda and Craig looked up in surprise as they saw Claire’s enormous rear that was now so big that it was pushing the back of her red hair up and had completely swallowed her hunchback. Both tiny humans couldn’t believe what they saw and since Claire didn’t know about her butt being so enormous, she was completely confused. “What?” she asked impatiently.

“Uh...” muttered Craig. “Nothing.” Claire rolled her eyes and held out her hand for her human-sized employees to crawl onto before she placed them both on the back of her neck. “Dang,” muttered Craig. “I don’t think there’s any back anymore with a butt this big. Claire always did have a rather big butt but not like this.” “Guess all those donuts at that monster trap run by those lunatics finally caught up with her.” Both Brenda and Craig had to climb onto Claire’s large behind in order to settle her back pain and Claire mumbled as the two humans walked on her back and then took out a guest book to go through. “Ambassadors are such a pain,” the chameleon thought to herself. “Everything had better go right. Ooh!” Brenda’s heels had dug into Claire’s behind and even after 10 minutes, neither human was even halfway to the top. Craig even poked the fleshy silver wall. “There is no way she got this pear-shaped by binging on donuts,” muttered Craig. “Do you think she knows?” “No way, Craig,” said Brenda. “And don’t tell her. If she thinks we’re being insulting, you had better hope she swallowed an unemployment office.” Claire took out her cell phone to check e-mails as she continued to moan from Brenda and Craig’s movement. “What’s taking them so long? It doesn’t feel like they’re at the top. Maybe I should’ve asked a monster to massage me.”

Claire went through her e-mail folder and started to delete junk files as she gave a hiss. “****ing junk mail. It’s bad enough in the real world, but in the virtual one?” At that moment, Brenda and Craig were at the top of Claire’s rear and they both looked down to see they were more than twice as high as Claire’s head. “She had better make good on that overtime.” Said Brenda as she kicked back and laid down while Craig was getting to work with the massage.

As Claire was checking her e-mail, she looked on her wrist and noticed Patty’s bracelet as her cross eyes focused on it and blinked in confusion. “Where did this bracelet come from?” thought the chameleon giantess. “I don’t remember putting on this bracelet. Heck. I don’t even remember buying this bracelet. Wait. This must be Patty’s. It has to be. It looks like the type of jewelry a werehippo would wear. Wait, didn’t Patty explicitly tell me NOT to put on this bracelet?! But I didn’t put it on. It must be sentient jewelry! It must’ve attached to my wrist when I wasn’t looking. I hate these Egyptian artifacts. They almost always have a nasty curse on them! And just my luck. My insurance policy doesn’t cover Egyptian magic. I don’t even think I want to know what this curse does.”

Outside of the hotel, Carina was wondering what to do about her growing booty and grumbled. “WHAT TO DO?! WHAT TO DO!? WHAT TO DO?!” Rebecca walked out, hearing Carina’s shouting. “Hey!” yelled the wendigo. “This is a hotel. Some of the guests might be trying to sleep. Please keep it down. We’re expecting a very important client.” Carina raised an eyebrow before she saw a newspaper vending machine. She put in a quarter with a crossbones symbol on it before she took out the paper and read it. “AMBASSADOR OF NEO-LEMURIA TO VISIT DIREOPOLIS!” Carina put down the newspaper and rubbed her chin. “HMMM,” thought Carina as loudly as she normally spoke. “DOESN’T THE AMBASSADOR OF NEO-LEMURIA HAVE AN INTEREST IN REPTILE GIRLS?! THIS MIGHT GET MY MIND OFF OF THIS STUPID BRACELET AND THE STUPID CURSE!”

Suddenly, there was a loud crash that caused Carina’s snake hair to stand on in as their eyes popped out in fear. “WHAT THE HECK WAS THAT!?” The crash had come from Claire’s office, as her enormous behind was too much for her chair to hold and it collapsed under the chameleon giantess’s mass. In the process, Craig and Brenda slid down Claire’s mountainous backside and screamed. Craig managed to save himself from falling by grabbing hold of Claire’s curved tail. Brenda however, slipped and fell in the back of Claire’s panties and was wedged between the two “mountains”. Craig looked down in surprise at Brenda’s position as the acid tongued human was pushed between the walls of silver chameleon flesh. “This is officially the lowest point in my career.”


Claire got up and gave a groan as she felt one of her thighs in pain. “Ow,” moaned the werelizard titaness. “Defective chair. Huh?” Claire felt around her thighs and then she moved her head and finally noticed how enormous her ass had become. She looked like she was about to have a heart attack when she saw exactly how large she had become and her face turned a paler shade of silver than usual and then her jaw dropped as she put a clawed hand to her head. Craig managed to climb to the top of the mountainous chameleon rear and gave a look of fear as one of Claire’s eyes twitched.

Back down the street, Patty was running as fast as she could towards the Rainbow Tongue Hotel, with Wes on her shoulder. Of course, that wasn’t particularly fast and Patty had to stop to catch her breath. “It’s days like this,” said the werehippo giantess. “That I really regret not taking driver’s ed.” “Maybe you should spend more time in the pool and less time in the kitchen.” Said Wes. Patty then let out a groan. “I really hope that Claire hasn’t put that bracelet on. The last thing we need is for two monster girls under that butt expansion curse.” “Oh come on,” said Wes. “Claire doesn’t even wear jewelry except for formal occasions.” “Except that there’s an ambassador coming to her hotel today, Wes. Claire would want to make a good impression." Suddenly, Patty's cell phone begun to ring. "Hello?" asked the werehippo woman. "Rebecca? You're kidding me! Carina's outside the hotel too?!" Patty hung up and then started to run on all fours this time. "Nothing's ever easy." She moaned.

It was at this moment that...
125332222222221221222.title: On the Chameleon's Back

125332222222221222.content:
After Patty left, Salli was stress-sucking a tomato as Allen sat on her head. “Can you believe that, Patty? She must think me and Pam are a couple of incompetent twits. That wounds me, Allen.” Allen rubbed the tip of Salli’s tusks as her fangs dripped of tomato juice. “Don’t listen to her, my vampire princess. You know how nasty that marble muncher can be when she’s stressed out.” Pam gave a snort as she was sorting the donuts and putting sprinkles on a pumpkin donut. “You know, Patty has been really pushy lately.” “Wes, too,” mutters Norman. “Those two deserve each other.” Patty is about to walk up to the grill but Salli stops her. “Uh-uh,” she says. “I handle the grill while Patty’s away.” “And why is that, hose nose?” “Because you only know how to cook donuts.” Norman let out a sigh as he held onto his wife’s ear. “She’s got you there, honey.”


Pam gave a snort but as she turned her head, she gasped. “Salli!” she yelled. “Look!” Salli turned her head and hovered over her porcine sister-in-law before Allen gasped. As it turned out, the second hippo queen bracelet was still on the kitchen counter. “The other bracelet,” said Allen. “Patty must’ve forgot it when she went out.” Salli let out a laugh. “She should’ve trusted me to take it to her safe. However, she saw the second bracelet on her plate and at first mistook it for a donut. “That’s funny,” thought the harpy to herself. “I distinctively told Patty that I only wanter three donuts. Not quatro. Oh well, who am I to say no to a free donut. Bottoms up.” Pinky bit into what she believed was a donut but then groaned in pain. “Ouch! This donut must be stale. Huh?” Pinky looked at the bracelet and finally realized that it wasn’t a donut. “Wait,” she said. “This isn’t a donut. It’s a bracelet. Looks Egyptian. It must belong to Patty.”  

It was at that point that the bracelet begun to twitch. “What the?” asked Pinky. The bracelet tried to fly to Pinky’s wrist, but since Pinky’s wings were attached to her arms, this made things difficult until the bracelet fell to the ground at Pinky’s massive talons. Before Pinky could react, the bracelet flew around her left ankle and tightened. “Hey!” yelled Pinky. “Pulsera loca!” Pinky waved her foot and to try and shake the bracelet off but then she heard Elisabeth and Beatrix speaking. “It looks like Ms. Ringmoore is staying in Direopolis for spring break,” said Elisabeth. “I know it shouldn’t but seeing a teacher out of school feels kind of weird to me.” “I’m kind of surprised that Ms. Ringmoore is still a teacher,” said Beatrix. “She’s been wearing that lucha libre costume for so long, you’d think she’d have become a real wrestler by now.” Pinky gave a scoff to herself. “I am a real wrestler.” She thought to herself angrily.

 Elisabeth bit her lip and then bit into a slice of pizza. “My mom doesn’t think that. She told me that Ms. Ringmoore was nothing but show.” “What?!” yelled Pinky in anger. As Pinky stood up, she didn’t notice that her wrestling speedo was getting tight on her body because of how big her butt was getting due to the cursed bracelet. “My mom is a boxer,” said Elisabeth. “And she says that in a real fight, Ms. Ringmoore would drop dead.” Pinky did not like what she heard and gave an angry glare. “Oh really!? Well, Elisabeth. You tell your mother that I can kick her large, wrinkled and unflattering ass any day of the week, anywhere.” Pinky in rage slammed her money on the table, not even waiting for Salli to return, and then walked out. Beatrix blinked slightly in confusion because Pinky’s butt cheeks were now as big as yoga balls and were rapidly getting bigger as she left. “Does Ms. Ringmoore look like she’s putting on weight to you?”

Elisabeth ignored her friend and called her mother to warn her about Pinky. At that time, Elisabeth’s mother, Isabella was at the gym punching at a punching bag until it exploded. Isabella was a 1300ft brown-skinned wererhino, resembling a prehistoric rhino called an indricotherium, which meant that unlike other wererhinos, she didn’t have a horn. She was even more apple-shaped than her daughter and was wearing a tiger print sari and a tanktop. She was completely bald and had a tattoo of Hawaii on her back. Elisabeth told Isabella about Pinky but the mother rhinoceros wasn’t even remotely worried. “Let that lolo harpy come,” said Isabella as she blew on her naked fist. “I was in the mood for fried chicken anyway. She only dresses like a wrestler to scare people. Those luchadores are all show. I’ll bet the only reason their wear those stupid masks is so they don’t embarrass themselves. I set up that wrestling ring in our backyard for a reason. I’ll talk to you later, sweetie. Mama has to get ready to kill that goony bird. Aloha.”

Isabella hung up but then she heard her cellphone ringing again and it was a phone number she didn’t recognize. She shrugged her shoulders and then answered it. "Aloha. Isabella Makoa speaking." "Mrs. Makoa, I'm calling you out, Bruja!" Isabella's eyes popped out. "You must be Mrs. Ringmoore. How did you get my phone number?" On the other end of the line, Pinky's ass had expanded to the point where it was a pair of wrecking balls but the harpy was too incensed to notice it. "That isn't the point, rhino rump. I challenge you to a fight in the ring. Your boxing vs. my lucha." Isabella gave a smirk. "I accept your challenge. Oh. But I have a neighbor who loves to fight and she wouldn't want to feel left out. To make it interesting, let's make it a tag battle. You and one of your friends vs. me and my friend." "Coward!" yelled Pinky. "But I accept your challenge." "Good. You and your partner meet me at my house and we'll see who is in Pele's favor."

Pinky hung up and grit her teeth before she decided to call her friends. Surely there would be somebody to help her stand up to Isabella and whoever she brought with her. First she decided to call Ethiopia Gnu, the catoblepas who had been trying to combine basketball and sumo. At the end of the line, Ethiopia was spinning her ball on her finger. "Sorry, Pinky," she said. "I can't. I'm babysitting my sister's kids today. Perhaps if you call again next week." Pinky then decided to call Deneb, the capricorn vigilante. At that moment, Deneb was sitting on top of an unconscious bank robber when she gave her answer. "This isn't a good time, Pinky. Call somebody else." Pinky's last bet was to try and call Patty herself who was just returning to Neo Neapolitan. "I've got bigger fish to fry, Pinky," said Patty. "I forgot to take something really important and dangerous back home when I should've." With that, Pinky hung up and then was wondering what to do.

But as Pinky was deep in thought, she turned her head and saw Carina walking down the street. At this point, their asses were equal in size. "Carina?" asked Pinky. "What happened to your butt?" Carina turned and noticed Pinky and gasped at the sight of her massive rear. "WHAT HAPPENED TO YOUR BUTT!" Pinky was confused but then shook her head. "Listen, Carina. How would you like to try your hand at lucha libre." "WTF!?"

It wasn't long until Carina was wearing a light blue lucha libre outfit with a stylized snake's skeleton on the mask and shirt and an ill-fitting speedo with a snake's face and open mouth on the front. "Bueno," said Pinky. "Now you look like a really real wrestler." Carina gave a glare and her snake hair hissed. "Oh, don't be that way. You look amazing. Let's go kick some rhino butt." Pinky then noticed her own enormous rear and squeezed one of her cheeks. "Speaking of which, how did my butt get so big? I must've had one donut too many."

Back at the Makoa residence, Isabella was waiting for Pinky with her human husband on her shoulder. "Isabella," said the Hawaiian man on the rhino's shoulder. "I don't think that fighting with one of our daughter's teachers is such a good idea." Isabella let out a laugh and rubbed her husband on the head. "Kaikane, you worry too much. Let's just say Elisabeth is going to need a substitute teacher for the next month." Pinky and Carina arrived and the Makoas looked in surprise. Isabella took one look at Pinky's ass and broke into laughter. "Oh, this is going to be easy. It's clear you haven't done any real fighting for a while, if ever. And you brought a gorgon as your aid? And Carina? Seriously." Carina gave a hiss. "JUST HIT US WITH YOUR BEST SHOT IF YOU CAN, ROCKSTEADY!" Isabella rolled her eyes. "I'm quaking and shaking. But now that I know who I'm up against, I think I'll call in my tag team partner."

Isabella blew on her fingers and then calls forth the monster girl who will be assisting her in the ring against Pinky and Carina...
125332222222221222222.title: Flamingo Fanny

1253322222222212222221.content:
Pinky and Carina turned their heads as they saw another giant monster woman stomping forward. From the looks of it, this one was a turquoise-skinned Lovecraftian with short tentacles for hair that appeared to be a darker shade of blue than the rest of her skin. Her lips were bright lavender and were covered in suction cups. She appeared to have long ears that reached down to her hips and resembled those of a Dumbo octopus. There were six sharp fingers on each hand and three sharp toes on each foot. She and a chubby stomach but well-toned abs and muscular arms and legs. She appeared to be dressed up in a black kick boxer's outfit. The Lovecraftian woman gave a loud and shrill hiss as Carina looked at her in fear. "EXACTLY WHAT DID YOU GET ME INTO, PINKY?" thought the gorgon giantess to herself.

Isabella gave a smug smirk as her tag partner walked right up towards her. The Lovecraftian giantess gave a growl. "You have got to be kidding me," hissed the cephalopod-based giantess. "These are who we're fighting today, Isabella? My feet are insulted to be up against such blatant jokers." Pinky gave a flamingo-like honk in rage and flapped her wings, only for her large behind to force her to reposition her feet in order to stand. “You arrogant pulpo!” yelled the luchadora flamingo. “I’m going to make you into takoyaki!” Carina waddled forward and groaned as she scratched her face and her snakes hissed. “PINKY,” she said. “CAN’T I TAKE OFF THIS RIDICULOUS MASK!?” Pinky just glared rather menacingly at her gorgon tag team partner. “You bite your forked tongue!” yelled Pinky as she kneed Carina in the rear and made her groan. “These masks are a symbol of honor!” Isabella then gave a smirk. “Not to mention a good way to hide all of your wrinkles, you decrepit crone.” Pinky became enraged and held out a foot filled with sharp talons. “I’m 27!” Isabella’s tag partner gave a hiss. “Is that your age or your number of ex-boyfriends!” Isabella gave a laugh. “Good one, Maria. As for your partner, exactly what kind of gorgon is she? Pick a snake and stick with it, lady.” Carina twitched an eye from underneath her sunglasses as her snake hair hissed. “You are so loud,” said Maria. “That you’re not aloud in the same town as a library.

Pinky then stepped in and glared at Maria and Isabella as Elisabeth sat on the sidelines with Kaikane on her shoulder. “OH YEAH!” yelled the gorgon. “THREE CAN PLAY AT THE CHEAP HEAT GAME! YOU, OCTOPUS FACE! YOUR SKIN IS SO DRY THAT MOSQUITOS NEED OIL RIGS TO DRINK YOUR BLOOD! THE LAST TIME I SAW LIPS LIKE YOURS, THEIR OWNER WAS BEING BURIED!” Pinky then stepped in. “Good work, Carina,” she said. “But let me try out. Hey, Isabella, if you’re the boxer you say you are, why do you work at the DMV?” “Joke’s on you, teacher,” said Isabella. “I make more than you do.” “Office supplies don’t count, rhino breath.” Said Pinky smugly. Maria piped in and hissed. “Well, your butt is so big, you could rent it out as a wrecking ball!” “Your ears are so big that you get all your candles for free.” “Oh yeah, where did you find your partner? A coloring book.” “BEATS THE FISH MARKET THAT ISABELLA FOUND YOU IN!” Isabella snorted and then chimed in. “At least she doesn’t have to hide behind a pair of tacky glasses.” It was at this point that Carina decided to shut Isabella up with a rather strong insult. “WELL I MAY HAVE SNAKES FOR HAIR, BUT AT LEAST I HAVE HAIR! YOU ARE SO BALD, YOU MAKE LEX LUTHOR LOOK LIKE RAPUNZEL!”

Elisabeth gasps upon hearing that insult towards her mother. “Oh no, she didn’t!” Immediately, Isabella becomes violently enraged and roars in pure fury. “Just for that,” said Elisabeth. “I’m going to tear you apart in the ring and kick that big butt of yours so bad that your grandchildren will be born with hemorrhoids!” Pinky gave a shriek. “Uh,” said Elisabeth. “Excuse me. But we need a referee.” Isabella gave a snort. “That’s your job, Elisabeth.” “Oh no!” yelled Pinky. “She’s your daughter!” “Are you implying that I’m a cheater?” Maria gave a hiss. “The bird brain is right. We need somebody to ref for us.” At that exact moment, Patty was running down the street with Wes on her shoulder. “I can’t believe it!” yelled Patty. “Mom and her cursed jewelry. I can’t believe I forgot that bracelet at Neo Neapolitan!” Wes rolled his eyes. “Just for the record, Dear,” he said. “My name is Wes.” Patty gave a snort. “I’m not in the mood for snarky husbands today.” It was there that Patty stopped in her tracks because she saw Pinky and Isabella staring at her and smirking. Patty gave a worried blink. “Scrud.” Groaned the werehippo giantess.

- - - - - -

It wasn’t long before Patty was dressed up in an ill-fitting referee’s outfit and was grumbling to herself. “How do I get myself into these messes?” she asked herself. Isabella and Maria both glared down at Pinky and Carina who glared back. “Think you can survive a fight when your behind is weighing you down?” Carina gave a hiss. “JUST WATCH, RHINO RUMP!” Maria lets out a shriek and jumps into the ring first as the match is about to begin and Isabella is ready to ring the bell.
1253322222222212222221.title: Ready to Rumble

125332222222222.content:
How about this one?

Pop Goes the Gorgon: Sicily Houlihan is a single mom who happens to be a 1000ft tall garter snake gorgon who lives in Growling Hills, a farming village populated by giant versions of the monsters of mythology. Sicily is minding her own business one day when she buys an unmarked bag of seeds that grow into a stalk of rainbow colored corn. However, this corn in particular has an odd effect on monsters and when she makes the corn into popcorn, the resulting snack food convinces Sicily that it is no ordinary vegetable she has come across.
125332222222222.title: Back with Back

1253322222222221.content:
It was a sunny day over Growling Hills. Growling Hills was like any other farming community out in the country miles away from civilization, except that the residents were giant monsters from all kinds of mythology. However, the citizens of Growling Hills had little to no interest in humans and just went along raising their crops and livestock. In the case of one particular gorgon, this crop was corn. Her name was Sicily Houlihan and she was a 1000ft tall somewhat pear-shaped gorgon with red and blue garter snakes for hair as well as pink skin with white diamond tattoos that bore a yellow outline. She was busy pouring water over her cornfield with a watering can when she heard a loud yelling.

“Hey, Mom! Be careful where you water!” “Oopsie,” said Sicily as she blushed. “Sorry, Perseus.” Out from the bottom of the cornfield came a human teenager, barely older than 15. This human was surprisingly Sicily’s son, Perseus. Sicily’s late husband was a human, largely because gorgons were an all female race and therefore had no choice but to seek their mates with other species. Normally gorgons only give birth to gorgons, but by some genetic fluke, Perseus was born a human male. Due to being half gorgon, he was immune to his mother’s petrifying gaze. Perseus was riding on a ladybug the size of a bus when his gorgon mother picked him up and her snake hair licked him. “Did you chase away all the bugs on this end?” “Yes, Mom,” said Perseus with a sigh. “I’ll bet we have the biggest cornfield in Growling Hills.” “I’ll say,” said Sicily. “I don’t think we’ll be able to harvest it all.” “That’s why you’re the Corn Queen of Growling Hills.”

Sicily let out a sigh. “That I am, my little prince, but the more successful the corn queen’s empire, the more the rest of the royalty are willing to go to war.” “They’re just jealous of your success.” Sicily smiled and then kissed her son as he let out a moan. Sicily’s enormous lips engulfed Perseus, accidentally pulling him into her mouth. Perseus let out a few muffled screams before Sicily opened her mouth and allowed him to walk down her forked tongue back into her hand. “Sorry, sugar. Oh sugar! That reminds me. We’re running low on supplies. I’ve got a few things to pick up at the store. Come on, Perseus.”

Sicily placed her son into the back pocket of her jeans before walking down the street. As she did so, she passed by one of her neighbors who was busy tending to her orchid garden. This neighbor was an overweight light blue-skinned gargoyle women with violet red hair that was worn in an enormous pompadour with a ponytail. “Hi, Orchid,” said Sicily. “That orchid garden is looking really good.” Orchid gave a smile as she got up. “Thanks, Sicily,” said the gargoyle in a southern belle accent. “And ah must say, that’s a pretty fine looking cornfield. But let’s be frank, my garden is just a teensy bit bigger.” Sicily raised an eyebrow as she hissed. “And why is that important?” Orchid let out a laugh as she continued to water her flowers. “Where have y’all been, Sicily? Haven’t ya heard? There’s an eligible bachelor coming to Growling Hills and he’s looking for a southern girl to be his bride. Word on the street is he’ll marry the gal who has the biggest plot of land and no offense, sweetie, that’s me.” Sicily shrugged her shoulders and then walked off.

On her way to the general store, Sicily passed by another of her neighbors. This neighbor was a wererhino resembling a woolly rhinoceros with long gold hair and violet-colored fur. From the looks of it, she was carrying a bowling ball in a bag. “Hi, Kendall,” said Perseus. “Going to hit the bowling alley.” Kendall gave a snort. “Just practicing for the tournament. Tell your mom that I’m going to kill her this saturday.” Sicily gave a scoff. “In your dreams, Kendall. I’ll dethrone you yet.” Perseus gave a sigh and then saw an election poster on a fence. The poster depicted a silver furred weretigress who from the looks of it was running for mayor of Growling Hills. “Looks like Mabel was serious about running for mayor, Mom,” says Perseus. “Are you going to vote for her?” Sicily shrugged her shoulders. “Who knows?” she asks. “Not many people in Growling Hills cares who’s going to be the mayor. I was thinking of running myself.” “Mom?” asks Perseus. “Serious? Mabel’s even more viciously competitive than Kendall.” Sicily gave a giggle as she finally reached the general store and took a basket to take some supplies.

“I think that perhaps we should try growing Indian corn for a change, Perseus. I’m going to pick up some seeds.” As Sicily walked up to pick up some seeds, she found a packet of seeds that surprisingly didn’t have a label, yet it did have a price tag. “Huh?” asked Sicily. “What kind of seeds are these?” The werecrocodile proprietor just shrugged his shoulders. “I have absolutely no idea, Mrs. Houlihan. They just came in this morning and I don’t have any idea where they’re from.” Sicily looked at the package just as a bright green-skinned baku girl with long black hair wearing a pair of rounded glasses and a sheriff’s uniform walked up towards the counter to pay for a handful of jellybeans. “I wouldn’t be messing with unknown seeds if I were you, Sicily,” said the sheriff in a Japanese accent. “For all you know, it could be something illegal.” “Oh, don’t you worry your tapir sides off, Kiriko,” said Sicily. “I won’t know until I plant them.” Kiriko took her jellybeans and begun to walk away. “Suit yourself, Sicily. But I have to warn you. A recently got wanted posters from a gang of witches the sheriff of Dreadberry warned me about. I’d be careful if I were you.” Sicily ignored the sheriff and paid for her supplies, including her seeds.

It wasn’t long before Sicily was walking back home. “I think Sheriff Zanki might’ve known what she was talking about, Mom.” Said Perseus. But before Perseus could voice his opinion any further, Sicily arrived back home and planted the seeds and watered them. “I doubt these seeds are carnivorous plants, Perseus. You have nothing to worry about.” Perseus gave a gulp. “I sure hope not. I’m lucky that most monsters in town think humans taste bad.” Sicily and Perseus walked inside, turning their backs to the seeds that they had planted into the ground.” Suddenly, the two of them heard a loud rumbling. “What the?!” Both the gorgon giantess and her human son ran out and looked in surprise. There was a glowing rainbow corn stalk where the seeds were planted. The rainbow corn had spread in with the rest of the cornfield and glowed in the sun. “Holy minotaur!” yelled Perseus as he stood on his mother’s shoulder. Sicily’s hair hissed as Sicily plucked an ear of corn. She sniffed it and bit into it only to yell in pain. “Well,” she said. “It doesn’t appear to be good raw.”

Sicily took the corn, removed the kernels and put them in a skillet before making them into rainbow popcorn. Sicily walked into the living room and turned on the TV station to the Yesterday network and munched the popcorn. “Yum,” she says. “This stuff isn’t half bad. Care for a bite, Perseus?” Sicily held up a piece of popcorn that was 3 times as big as her son but Perseus shook his head. “No thanks,” he said. “I don’t think that stuff is meant for humans.” Sicily shrugged her shoulders. “Alright, but try not to fall into the popcorn. I don’t feel like having my stomach pumped again.” As Sicily ate the popcorn, she had no idea that it would have terrifying side effects that would occur...
1253322222222221.title: Pop Goes the Gorgon

12533222222222212.content:
There didn’t appear to be any immediate effects from eating the rainbow popcorn and instead, it gave a loud crunching sound that forced Perseus to cover his ears as he sat on his gorgon mother’s shoulder. “Not bad,” said Sicily as she watched the Corona Poe movie on the television. “But it needs some butter. Oh good. A commercial. I’ll just pay a visit to Regina next door.” Perseus stuck out his tongue. “Yuck. Capricorn milk?” “What choice do I have, Perseus?” asks Sicily as she gets up and makes her way towards the front door. “Mrs. Gorelick has a terrible cold. Drinking milk from a sick minotaur? Not a good idea.” Sicily placed Perseus into her back pocket and ran through the cornfield as fast as she could in order to avoid missing the movie on the television as she crossed over to her second next door neighbor, Regina Spade. As she was running, Sicily placed Perseus into her back pocket, where Perseus felt the ‘walls’ and noticed they were softer. Of course, that wasn’t the only thing that he noticed. “That’s odd,” thought the half-gorgon human. “It seems to be tighter in here than usual.

Regina Spade was an enormously obese Asian capricorn who from the waist up resembled a spiral horned goat with bright blue fur and short black hair but with golden scales on her legs like that of a fish and gills on her neck. She was watching the same movie that Sicily was. It was a movie that depicted a minotaur girl resembling a cross between a buffalo and a Native American woman who from the looks of it was engaged in a sumo match on the top of a bullet train with an evil-looking bronze furred weretiger with bluish green stripes, blackish green hair and an eyepatch. “Push her off the train, Rough Ruth!” yells Regina to the TV. “Go get her!” Regina then hears a knock on the door and grumbles. “Why do people always burst in when I’m watching something?” Regina rolls her wheelchair to the front door and opens it to see Sicily. She instinctively covers her eyes. “For crying out loud! Put your glasses on.” Sicily gives a gasp and then takes out a sunglasses case and puts her glasses in. “There. Sorry.” Since Perseus was immune to Sicily’s petrifying gaze, the gorgon giantess usually didn’t wear her sunglasses in the house. Because it was fatal to look a gorgon in the eye, gorgons were required to wear sunglasses that canceled out the petrification. Regina gives a grumble and opens her eyes. “What do you want?” asks the capricorn rudely.

“Excuse me, Regina,” says Sicily. “You wouldn’t happen to have some butter that I could borrow? I need it for my popcorn.” Regina gives a gag and sticks out her tongue. “It’s right in the fridge,” she says. “Take it. I hate popcorn. How can you eat that junkfood.” Sicily looks at how enormously fat Regina is and gives a smirk. “Like you’re one to talk about junk food. Can you even walk?” Regina gives a rather sour look. “You know where it is, Houlihan,” she says angrily. “This movie has Corona Poe as the leading lady. If you think that I’m missing it, you have another thing coming.” Sicily shook her head and then made her way to Regina’s refrigerator to take the butter she needed and then turned around and closed the fridge with her rear, not noticing that she left a dent in it. In the process, Perseus let out a grunt, which prompted his enormous mother to give a look of surprise and embarrassment. “Oops,” says Sicily. “Sorry, Perseus.” Regina gives a look of surprise. “Perseus is with you?” the goat giantess asks as she licks her lips. Sicily gives a glare at Regina. “Don’t even think about it.” With that, Sicily storms off and runs back to her house to melt the butter onto the popcorn as she continues to watch her movie.

- -

After the movie ended, Sicily had gone to bed and placed Perseus in his bed on the table right next to her own. As both the titanic gorgon and her tiny human son were snoozing, the full effects of the corn that Sicily ate were about to be seen. As she slept, Sicily’s mattress made several squeaking noises as the bed springs were coming apart and the mattress was sinking. Sicily’s lower body was expanding at a rapid rate and the legs on her bed bent from the critical expanding mass.

The next morning, the alarm clock rang loudly and Perseus sprung out of his bed with a grumble. “As usual,” he said as he took out a ladder and walked to the house-sized clock. “I’m the one who has to stop the clock.” As Perseus turned the clock off, he heard a loud crash that was right next to him. “What the... oh my gosh! Mom! Wake up!” Sicily sprung up groggily and got out of bed. However, she now looked vastly different. Her butt was much bigger than it was before, to the point where it reached her shoulders and was taking up more than her entire bed. Her pajama pants were coming apart at the seams. However, she was too tired to notice and accidentally knocked over the table next to her bed, forcing Perseus to jump on one of her cheeks and crawl frantically up to her ear. “Mom! Watch out!” Sicily yawned again. “What is it, Perseus? It’s not even 4 in the morning.” “Uh,” said Perseus to his giant mother. “Look.” Sicily looked forward and gasped as she saw her enormous behind in the mirror. “Oh my gosh!” she yelled.

The gorgon giantess needed three entire mirrors to see how enormous she had gotten and tapped on one of her butt cheeks to make it shake as she bit her lip. “Mom,” said Perseus. “Please don’t freak?” How exactly does Sicily react?
12533222222222212.title: Morning Mess

1253322222222222.content: The Original Gorgon: For this story, we will be following the original Gorgon, Medusa (not the same one from Medusa's revenge). Here, she was born a gorgon, and is a simple woman living on a small island. One day, Athena decides to challenge her to a game of wits, a game Medusa wins. For her victory, Medusa asks for immortality, which Athena grants, but at a cost: for the rest of Medusa's immortal life, her butt will never stop growing.
